xep.title: Waiting Lists
xep.abstract: This document defines an XMPP protocol extension that enables a user to add a non-IM user to a waiting list and be informed when the contact creates an IM account.

last-revision.remark: Cross-document editorial adjustments for inclusive language.

xep.title: Persistent Storage of Private Data via PubSub
xep.abstract: This specification defines best practices for using the XMPP publish-subscribe extension to persistently store private information such as bookmarks and client configuration options.

last-revision.remark: Make discovery of support mandatory, add security considerations (in reaction to CVE-2018-6591).

xep.title: XMPP Server Registration for use with Kerberos V5
xep.abstract: This specification defines the Kerberos principal name of an XMPP server. It also details a method by which a connecting client can determine this Kerberos principal name when authenticating using the "GSSAPI" SASL mechanism.

last-revision.remark: Move to draft by order of the XMPP Council.

xep.title: Client Certificate Management for SASL EXTERNAL
xep.abstract: This specification defines a method to manage client certificates that can be used with SASL External to allow clients to log in without a password.

last-revision.remark: * Removed the dependency on . * Placed the certificate data directly in the <append/> element. * Clarified up the usage of the certificate's name. * Increased the version to 'urn:xmpp:saslcert:1'. * Added a section on discovering support. * Added the possibility for the server to send a list of currently used certificates. * Updated the relation with to match the current version.

xep.title: Cryptographic Hash Function Recommendations for XMPP
xep.abstract: This document provides recommendations for the use of cryptographic hash functions in XMPP protocol extensions.

last-revision.remark: Make Blake2b-256 SHOULD and Blake2b 512 MUST

xep.title: Pubsub Subscription
xep.abstract: This specification describe a method that allow a user to share a list of nodes on which it is Pubsub registered

last-revision.remark: Initial published version approved by the XMPP Council.

xep.title: Agent Information
xep.abstract: This specification provides canonical documentation of the obsolete Agent Information namespace. Note: This document has been superseded by XEP-0030: Service Discovery.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the Jabber Council, changed status to Obsolete. The protocol described herein is accurately defined but actively deprecated in favor of Service Discovery (XEP-0030).

xep.title: Flexible Offline Message Retrieval
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for flexible, POP3-like handling of offline messages. The protocol enables a connecting client to retrieve its offline messages on login in a controlled fashion, without receiving a flood of messages. Messages can also be left on the server for later retrieval.

last-revision.remark: Deprecate after council vote of 2021-03-31

xep.title: PEP Native Bookmarks
xep.abstract: This specification defines a syntax and storage profile for keeping a list of chatroom bookmarks on the server.

last-revision.remark: Add missing <supersedes/> for XEP-0411

xep.title: vCard Filtering
xep.abstract: This document specifies a mechanism for requesting specific sections of a vCard.

last-revision.remark: Initial version.

xep.title: XMPP Basic Server 2008
xep.abstract: This document defines the XMPP Basic Server 2008 compliance level.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the XMPP Council, advanced to Draft.

xep.title: Invisible Presence
xep.abstract: Documentation of invisible presence.

last-revision.remark: Updated to focus solely on <presence type='invisible'/>.

xep.title: Stream Compression
xep.abstract: This document defines an XMPP protocol extension for negotiating compression of XML streams, especially in situations where standard TLS compression cannot be negotiated. The protocol provides a modular framework that can accommodate a wide range of compression algorithms; the ZLIB compression algorithm is mandatory-to-implement, but implementations may support other algorithms in addition.

last-revision.remark: Obsolete due to security vulnerability.

xep.title: SI File Transfer
xep.abstract: This specification defines a profile of the XMPP stream initiation extension for transferring files between two entities. The protocol provides a modular framework that enables the exchange of information about the file to be transferred as well as the negotiation of parameters such as the transport to be used.

last-revision.remark: Fix incorrect reference to sipub namespace

xep.title: Entity Capabilities 2.0
xep.abstract: This document overhauls the XMPP protocol extension Entity Capabilities (XEP-0115). It defines an XMPP protocol extension for broadcasting and dynamically discovering client, device, or generic entity capabilities. In order to minimize network impact, the transport mechanism is standard XMPP presence broadcast (thus forestalling the need for polling related to service discovery data), the capabilities information can be cached either within a session or across sessions, and the format has been kept as small as possible.

last-revision.remark: Explain that ASCII Seperators are only invalid in XML 1.0, but not in XML 1.1.

xep.title: XMPP over QUIC
xep.abstract: This specification defines a procedure to make both c2s and s2s XMPP connections over the QUIC protocol instead of TCP+TLS.

last-revision.remark: Accepted by vote of Council on 2022-06-22.

xep.title: Best Practice for Closing Idle Streams
xep.abstract: This document specifies a best practice for closing an XML stream that is perceived to be idle.

last-revision.remark: Changed status to Obsolete because it is superseded by RFC 6120.

xep.title: Shared Groups
xep.abstract: This document defines a protocol profile for centrally defined and administered roster groups; the protocol described herein has been retracted in favor of XEP-0144: Roster Item Exchange.

last-revision.remark: Retracted in favor of XEP-0144.

xep.title: Use of ZRTP in Jingle RTP Sessions
xep.abstract: This specification defines how to use ZRTP (RFC 6189) in the Jingle application type for the Real-time Transport Protocol (RTP) as a way to negotiate media path key agreement for secure RTP in one-to-one media sessions.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the XMPP Council, advanced specification to Draft.

xep.title: HTTP File Upload
xep.abstract: This specification defines a protocol to request permissions from another entity to upload a file to a specific path on an HTTP server and at the same time receive a URL from which that file can later be downloaded again.

last-revision.remark: * Filename size in bytes. * Headers MUST be included in the PUT request. * Headers considered opaque. * Servers may want to sign headers, in security implications. * Allow header case insensitivity, multiple times the same header, and preserve the order in the HTTP request.

xep.title: No Such XEP
xep.abstract: This document was removed from the XSF website and source control at the request of the author.

last-revision.remark: No such specification.

xep.title: DTCP
xep.abstract: Direct TCP connection between two Jabber entities.

last-revision.remark: At the request of the author, changed status to Retracted.

xep.title: Portable Import/Export Format for XMPP-IM Servers
xep.abstract: This document specifies a file format for importing and exporting user data to and from XMPP-IM servers.

last-revision.remark: Discourage use of 'password', provide a way to include SCRAM credentials, PEP nodes and message archives.

xep.title: Data Forms - Dynamic Forms
xep.abstract: This specification provides extensions to the data forms model defined in previous XEPs that permit enhanced end-user interaction and a better user experience. These extensions permit forms to react on user input by permitting the addition, updating or removal of fields in the form and server-side validation of fields. The extension also defines new states making it possible to display disabled controls, controls with undefined values or error messages, while still being backwards compatible with the existing data form model with available extensions.

last-revision.remark: Updated contact information. Updated example JIDs to example.org

xep.title: Special Interest Groups (SIGs)
xep.abstract: A definition of Special Interest Groups within the XMPP Standards Foundation.

last-revision.remark: Clarified some details and added information about cut-offs for inactivity.

xep.title: Presence Obtained via Kinesthetic Excitation (POKE)
xep.abstract: This document defines an XMPP protocol extension that enables probing for presence via physical rather than electronic means.

last-revision.remark: April Fools!

xep.title: Jabber URI Scheme
xep.abstract: A URI scheme for Jabber communications.

last-revision.remark: Retracted the document, since it is superseded by draft-ietf-xmpp-uri, an Internet-Draft produced by the IETF's XMPP WG.

xep.title: DSPS - Data Stream Proxy Service
xep.abstract: A proposal for proxy support in Jabber.

last-revision.remark: Made the revision’s version element include only the actual version.

xep.title: Basic IM Protocol Suite
xep.abstract: This document defines a recommended suite of Jabber/XMPP protocols to be supported by basic instant messaging and presence applications. Note: This protocol suite has been obsoleted by XEP-0211 and XEP-0212.

last-revision.remark: Cross-document editorial adjustments for inclusive language.

xep.title: Message Processing Hints
xep.abstract: This document defines a way to include hints to entities routing or receiving a message.

last-revision.remark: Defer due to lack of activity.

xep.title: Last Message Correction
xep.abstract: This specification defines a method for indicating that a message is a correction of the last sent message.

last-revision.remark: Fix disco#info example to use correct addresses.

xep.title: Icon Styles
xep.abstract: A protocol for specifying exchangeable styles of emoticons and genicons within Jabber IM clients.

last-revision.remark: Obsolete due to the omnipresence of Unicode emoji, as well as Bits of Binary stickers.

xep.title: Pubsub Message Archive Management
xep.abstract: This document defines a protocol to query and control a pubsub node's message archive.

last-revision.remark: Accepted by vote of Council on 2020-08-19.

xep.title: XMPP Compliance Suites 2018
xep.abstract: This document defines XMPP protocol compliance levels.

last-revision.remark: Move to Draft as per Council vote on 2018-01-24.

xep.title: Stream Initiation
xep.abstract: A common method to initiate a stream with meta information

last-revision.remark: Fix incorrect URL to SI namespace.

xep.title: Encryption for stateless file sharing
xep.abstract: This specification provides a protocol for sharing encrypted files using the stateless file sharing protocol (XEP-0447).

last-revision.remark: * Replace the ProtoXEP reference with a reference to the published XEP. * Add urn:xmpp:ciphers:aes-256-cbc-pkcs7:0 (same as used in XEP-0384).

xep.title: Enhanced Private XML Storage
xep.abstract: Standardizes "private" XML data storage.

last-revision.remark: Initial version.

xep.title: Stanza Encryption
xep.abstract: This document specifies an XMPP protocol extension for session-based stanza encryption.

last-revision.remark: Added reference to Simplified Encrypted Session Negotiation; modified namespaces to reflect XMPP Registrar procedures regarding URN issuance.

xep.title: PubSub Queueing
xep.abstract: This specification defines an extension to XMPP publish-subscribe for queueing information at a node.

last-revision.remark: Initial published version.

xep.title: XMPP Compliance Suites 2019
xep.abstract: This document defines XMPP protocol compliance levels.

last-revision.remark: Deprecate and Obsolete per Council vote on 2020-01-22

xep.title: Language Translation
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for providing language translation facilities over XMPP. It supports human, machine, client-based, and server-based translations.

last-revision.remark: Corrected XML schema to note a number of constructs are optional not required (Christian Schudt).

xep.title: Jabber Robust Publish-Subscribe
xep.abstract: Note: This proposal has been superseded by XEP-0060; please refer to that document for the successor protocol.

last-revision.remark: Formally retracted this proposal in favor of XEP-0060: Publish-Subscribe.

xep.title: Instant Messaging Intelligence Quotient (IM IQ)
xep.abstract: This specification provides canonical documentation of the jabber:iq:iq namespace.

last-revision.remark: April Fools!

xep.title: Security Extensions
xep.abstract: Security extensions for Jabber/XMPP.

last-revision.remark: Initial version.

xep.title: Ad-Hoc Commands
xep.abstract: This document defines an XMPP protocol extension for advertising and executing application-specific commands, such as those related to a configuration workflow. Typically the commands contain data forms (XEP-0004) in order to structure the information exchange.

last-revision.remark: Clarify illegal uses of 'execute'.

xep.title: Attention
xep.abstract: This document defines an XMPP protocol extension for getting the attention of another user.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the XMPP Council, advanced specification to Draft.

xep.title: Time Periods
xep.abstract: This document defines a method to specify the valid time periods for states, events, and activities communicated via Jabber/XMPP protocols.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the Jabber Council, advanced status to Active.

xep.title: Multi-User Chat
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for multi-user text chat, whereby multiple XMPP users can exchange messages in the context of a room or channel, similar to Internet Relay Chat (IRC). In addition to standard chatroom features such as room topics and invitations, the protocol defines a strong room control model, including the ability to kick and ban users, to name room moderators and administrators, to require membership or passwords in order to join the room, etc.

last-revision.remark: Remove more mentions of Group Chat 1.0.

xep.title: Best Practices for Resource Locking
xep.abstract: This document specifies best practices to be followed by Jabber/XMPP clients about when to lock into, and unlock away from, resources.

last-revision.remark: Expanded intro with a short problem description; moved chat states considerations to their own section; tightened requirement regarding a message from different resource from MAY to SHOULD; loosened requirement regarding a message with 'gone' from MUST to SHOULD; added missing but required sections

xep.title: XMPP Ping
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for sending application-level pings over XML streams. Such pings can be sent from a client to a server, from one server to another, or end-to-end.

last-revision.remark: Fix incorrect IQ type in example (result => error)

xep.title: Encrypted Session Negotiation
xep.abstract: This document specifies an XMPP protocol extension for negotiating an end-to-end encrypted session.

last-revision.remark: Split pubkey field into init_pubkey and resp_pubkey fields; modified namespaces to reflect XMPP Registrar procedures regarding URN issuance.

xep.title: IQ-Based Avatars
xep.abstract: This specification provides historical documentation of an IQ-based protocol for exchanging user avatars.

last-revision.remark: * Move from deferred to obsolete. * Add the two superseding specifications.

xep.title: OpenPGP for XMPP
xep.abstract: Specifies end-to-end encryption and authentication of data with the help of OpenPGP, announcement, discovery and retrieval of public keys and a mechanism to synchronize secret keys over multiple devices.

last-revision.remark: Recommend PubSub access model 'open' for public key data node and metadata node.

xep.title: Entity Metadata
xep.abstract: NOTE: This proposal was retracted by the author on 2004-02-19.

last-revision.remark: Incorporated infobits changes and vCard infobit mappings; metadata about relationships to be moved to forthcoming specification.

xep.title: Multiparty Jingle (Muji)
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for initiating and managing multiparty voice and video conferences within an XMPP MUC

last-revision.remark: Fix typos / grammar / examples and use 'Muji' instead of 'muji' consistently

xep.title: Full Namespace Support for XML Streams
xep.abstract: A description of the use of namespaces within Jabber.

last-revision.remark: Initial version.

xep.title: Source-Specific Media Attributes in Jingle
xep.abstract: This specification provides an XML mapping for translating the RFC 5766 Source-Specific Media Attributes from SDP to Jingle

last-revision.remark: Add a XML Schema, and fix an example lacking a namespace.

xep.title: Service Directories
xep.abstract: This specification shows how to combine and extend a number of existing XMPP protocols for improved sharing of information about XMPP servers.

last-revision.remark: Corrected a number of details in the text, examples, and XMPP Registrar considerations; removed an extraneous section that is better contained in XEP-0267.

xep.title: User Browsing
xep.abstract: This document defines an XMPP protocol extension for communicating information about the web pages a user visits.

last-revision.remark: Modified namespace in accordance with protocol versioning policies.

xep.title: Security SIG
xep.abstract: This document proposes the formation of a Special Interest Group devoted to the analysis of security threats related to Jabber technologies.

last-revision.remark: Changed status to Retracted since it now appears unnecessary to form a SIG in order to complete this work; rather, it should be sufficient to write a XEP and solicit feedback from appropriate security experts before the Last Call. However, such a XEP should use the process described herein.

xep.title: Unique Room Names for Multi-User Chat
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for requesting a unique room ID from a multi-user chat service.

last-revision.remark: Initial published version.

xep.title: Dialback Key Generation and Validation
xep.abstract: This document provides a recommended method for generating and validating the keys used in the XMPP server dialback protocol.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the XMPP Council, advanced specification to Active.

xep.title: Spam Reporting
xep.abstract: This document specifies a mechanism by which users can report spam and other abuse to a server operator or other spam service.

last-revision.remark: Rework based on list feedback.

xep.title: Serverless Messaging
xep.abstract: This specification defines how to communicate over local or wide-area networks using the principles of zero-configuration networking for endpoint discovery and the syntax of XML streams and XMPP messaging for real-time communication. This method uses DNS-based Service Discovery and Multicast DNS to discover entities that support the protocol, including their IP addresses and preferred ports. Any two entities can then negotiate a serverless connection using XML streams in order to exchange XMPP message and IQ stanzas.

last-revision.remark: Fix incorrect STARTTLS examples.

xep.title: Whiteboarding SIG
xep.abstract: A proposal to form a SIG to develop a protocol for whiteboarding over Jabber.

last-revision.remark: Changed Status to Obsolete per approval of XEP-0019.

xep.title: Annotations
xep.abstract: This document defines a protocol for making annotations about roster items and other entities.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the Jabber Council, advanced to Active.

xep.title: XMPP Intermediate IM Client 2008
xep.abstract: This document defines the XMPP Intermediate IM Client 2008 compliance level.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the XMPP Council, advanced to Draft.

xep.title: Service Outage Status
xep.abstract: This document defines an XMPP protocol extension that enables server administrators to communicate issues with the server to all users in a semantic manner.

last-revision.remark: Evolve the standard: Editorial restructuring, add business rules and security considerations and clarify some wording.

xep.title: Legacy Delayed Delivery
xep.abstract: This specification provides historical documentation of the legacy jabber:x:delay namespace, which has been deprecated in favor the urn:xmpp:delay namespace defined in XEP-0203.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the XMPP Council, changed status to Obsolete.

xep.title: Message Stanza Profiles
xep.abstract: This document specifies best practices for generating and handling extended content in XMPP message stanzas.

last-revision.remark: For consistency, defined Metadata Profile; specified that the registrar shall create a registry for message stanza profiles.

xep.title: Jabber-RPC
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for transporting XML-RPC encoded requests and responses between two XMPP entities. The protocol supports all syntax and semantics of XML-RPC except that it uses XMPP instead of HTTP as the underlying transport.

last-revision.remark: Cross-document editorial adjustments for inclusive language.

xep.title: Message Replies
xep.abstract: This document defines a way to indicate that a message is a reply to a previous message.

last-revision.remark: Accepted by vote of Council on 2022-01-05.

xep.title: Component Connections
xep.abstract: This document specifies a standards-track XMPP protocol extension that enables server components to connect to XMPP servers.

last-revision.remark: Modified namespace to incorporate namespace versioning; clarified that the value of the <hostname/> element can be either <domain> or <domain/resource>.

xep.title: Jingle Content Thumbnails
xep.abstract: This specification defines a way for a client to supply a preview image for Jingle content.

last-revision.remark: Changed format to use generic 'uri' attribute to allow for 'https:' and 'http:' URIs in addition to BoB 'cid:' URIs. Indicated that multiple thumbnails may be present. Expanded scope of use cases to be Jingle content in general, not just file transfer.

xep.title: Recommended Order of Stream Feature Negotiation
xep.abstract: This document specifies a recommended order for negotiation of XMPP stream features.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the XMPP Council, advanced status to Active.

xep.title: Hats
xep.abstract: This specification defines a more extensible model for roles and affiliations in Multi-User Chat rooms.

last-revision.remark: Initial published version approved for publication by the XMPP Council; clarified ad-hoc commands logic and syntax.

xep.title: Binary XMPP
xep.abstract: This specification defines Binary XMPP, an obviously superior representation of the Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol (XMPP).

last-revision.remark: April Fools!

xep.title: Jingle Video via RTP
xep.abstract: Note: This specification has been retracted in favor of XEP-0167, which now consolidates both audio and video chat via RTP and therefore contains the content originally published in this specification; please refer to XEP-0167 for the most up-to-date definition of XMPP video chat. This specification defines a Jingle application type for negotiating a video chat or other video session. The application type uses the Real-time Transport Protocol (RTP) for the underlying media exchange and provides a straightforward mapping to Session Description Protocol (SDP) for interworking with SIP media endpoints.

last-revision.remark: Retracted in favor of XEP-0167, which now consolidates both audio and video chat via RTP and therefore contains the content originally published in this specification.

xep.title: Stanza Forwarding
xep.abstract: This document defines a protocol to forward a stanza from one entity to another.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the XMPP Council, advanced status to Draft.

xep.title: Multi-Factor Authentication with TOTP
xep.abstract: This specification defines support for multi-factor authentication in terms of SASL2 Tasks based around the Time-based One Time Password mechanism.

last-revision.remark: Accepted by vote of Council on 2018-01-10.

xep.title: Encryption of Archived Messages
xep.abstract: This specification defines methods for encrypting messages that are archived at an XMPP server.

last-revision.remark: Initial version, split off from XEP-0136 per XMPP Council consensus.

xep.title: DNS Queries over XMPP (DoX)
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for sending DNS queries and getting DNS responses over XML streams. Each DNS query-response pair is mapped into an IQ exchange.

last-revision.remark: Accepted by vote of Council on 2019-03-13.

xep.title: Location Query
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for querying a compliant server or service for information about the geographical or physical location of an entity.

last-revision.remark: Fix a bunch of typos, batch-style.

xep.title: MUC Affiliations Versioning
xep.abstract: This specification provides a way to reduce the amount of queries necessary to stay up-to-date with affiliations in a MUC room.

last-revision.remark: Accepted by vote of Council on 2022-02-16.

xep.title: Delayed Delivery
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for communicating the fact that an XML stanza has been delivered with a delay, for example because a message has been stored on a server while the intended recipient was offline or because a message is contained in the history of a multi-user chat room.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the XMPP Council, advanced specification from Draft to Final; also addressed a security concern about forged timestamps that was provided during the Call for Experience.

xep.title: XMPP Compliance Suites 2016
xep.abstract: This document defines XMPP protocol compliance levels for 2016.

last-revision.remark: Don't require both BOSH and Websockets.

xep.title: OTR Discovery
xep.abstract: This document provides a mechanism by which OTR encryption support can be discovered in XMPP, without relying on OTRs protocol agnostic discovery mechanism.

last-revision.remark: Defer due to lack of activity.

xep.title: Improving Baseline Security in XMPP
xep.abstract: This document describes a number of concrete and effective mechanisms for offering significant security enhancements to XMPP, with broad applicability.

last-revision.remark: Acceptance as XEP-0419; Light editing.

xep.title: Signing Forms
xep.abstract: This specification describes a method whereby a client can sign a form using credentials not related to the current connection.

last-revision.remark: Defer due to lack of activity.

xep.title: Extended Roster
xep.abstract: This document defines a way to handle extended roster items.

last-revision.remark: Changed the status to Retracted at the request of the author, since the proposed protocol was incompatible with XMPP and clients have begun using jabber:iq:private for this kind of functionality.

xep.title: MUC Fast Reconnect
xep.abstract: This document provides a protocol that can be used for limiting the amount of presence history needed when rejoining a MUC room.

last-revision.remark: Version approved for publication by the XMPP Council.

xep.title: Service Administration
xep.abstract: This document defines recommended best practices for service-level administration of servers and components using Ad-Hoc Commands.

last-revision.remark: Fix broken node value in example.

xep.title: Ephemeral Messages
xep.abstract: This specification encourages a shift in privacy settings wrt. logging policies.

last-revision.remark: Accepted by vote of Council on 2022-05-03.

xep.title: Stanza Multiplexing
xep.abstract: This spec provides a mechanism for multiplexing multiple virtual hosts over a single XMPP session.

last-revision.remark: Accepted by vote of Council on 2020-12-09.

xep.title: Message Tone
xep.abstract: A proposal for including the sender's tone in messages.

last-revision.remark: First release to CVS, including editorial changes and assignment of number.

xep.title: Hop Check
xep.abstract: This document defines an XMPP protocol extension that enables an entity to check the security of client-to-server and server-to-server hops between it and another entity. Note: This specification has been retracted by the author because the problem is not compelling and a real solution would be too complicated.

last-revision.remark: Retracted by the author because the problem is not compelling and a real solution would be too complicated.

xep.title: Mediated Information eXchange (MIX): MIX Administration
xep.abstract: This document defines an extension to Mediated Information eXchange (MIX) specified in XEP-0369. This specification defines a framework for MIX administration and administration operations.

last-revision.remark: Fix reference to PubSub namespace

xep.title: Form Discovery and Publishing
xep.abstract: This specification describes a series of conventions that allow the management of form templates and publishing of completed forms.

last-revision.remark: Defer due to lack of activity.

xep.title: Mediated Information eXchange (MIX): JID Hidden Channels.
xep.abstract: This document defines an extension to Mediated Information eXchange (MIX) specified in XEP-0369. This specification extends MIX to provide a number of privacy control options and in particular JID Hidden Channels.

last-revision.remark: Various XML example cleanup and fixes

xep.title: HTTP over XMPP transport
xep.abstract: This specification defines how XMPP can be used to transport HTTP communication over peer-to-peer networks.

last-revision.remark: Fix spelling error

xep.title: Best Practices for Roster and Subscription Management
xep.abstract: This document specifies best practices for roster and subscription management in Jabber/XMPP clients.

last-revision.remark: Fixed small typos

xep.title: vCard4 Over XMPP
xep.abstract: This document specifies an XMPP extension for use of the vCard4 XML format in XMPP systems, with the intent of obsoleting the vcard-temp format.

last-revision.remark: Recommend use of contact bare JIDs for item IDs

xep.title: Client State Indication
xep.abstract: This document defines a way for the client to indicate its active/inactive state.

last-revision.remark: Accepted as Draft as per Council vote from 2020-08-26.

xep.title: HTTP Scheme for URL Data
xep.abstract: This document provides a schema description for detailed information about HTTP URLs.

last-revision.remark: Add missing 'http:' prefix in example elements

xep.title: Internet of Things - Discovery
xep.abstract: This specification describes an architecture based on the XMPP protocol whereby Things can be installed and safely discovered by their owners and connected into networks of Things.

last-revision.remark: Fix a bunch of typos, batch-style.

xep.title: IO Data
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for handling the input to and output from a remote entity.

last-revision.remark: Initial published version.

xep.title: Jabber HTTP Polling
xep.abstract: This document defines an XMPP protocol extension that enables access to a Jabber server from behind firewalls which do not allow outgoing sockets on port 5222, via HTTP requests.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the XMPP Council, changed status to Obsolete.

xep.title: User Avatar to vCard-Based Avatars Conversion
xep.abstract: This specification describes a method for using PEP based avatars and vCard based avatars in parallel by having the user’s server do a conversion between the two.

last-revision.remark: Add missing article "the".

xep.title: XMPP Server Compliance 2009
xep.abstract: This document defines XMPP server compliance levels for 2009.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the XMPP Council, advanced specification to Draft.

xep.title: Zero Handshake Server to Server Protocol
xep.abstract: This specification defines an approach for a pair of servers to eliminate initial handshakes and associated data transfer when using the XMPP S2S Protocol. This approach may only be used with a priori agreement and configuration of the two servers involved. This is of significant benefit in high latency environments.

last-revision.remark: Defer due to lack of activity.

xep.title: Bidirectional-streams Over Synchronous HTTP (BOSH)
xep.abstract: This specification defines a transport protocol that emulates the semantics of a long-lived, bidirectional TCP connection between two entities (such as a client and a server) by efficiently using multiple synchronous HTTP request/response pairs without requiring the use of frequent polling or chunked responses.

last-revision.remark: Fix incorrect attribute name in text (from vs. to)

xep.title: Invisible Command
xep.abstract: This document specifies an XMPP protocol extension for user invisibility.

last-revision.remark: Defer due to lack of activity.

xep.title: Room Activity Indicators
xep.abstract: This specification describes a lightweight mechanism for activity notifications in MUCs

last-revision.remark: Assign urn:xmpp namespace instead of xmpp:prosody.im namespace (this was missed during acceptance)

xep.title: Definition of Jabber Identifiers (JIDs)
xep.abstract: Note well: this document was superseded by RFC 3920, which in turn has been superseded by RFC 6122. This document defines the exact nature of a Jabber Identifier (JID).

last-revision.remark: Changed status to Retracted. This document is superseded by the XMPP Core memo defined by the IETF's XMPP Working Group.

xep.title: Mediated Information eXchange (MIX)
xep.abstract: This document defines Mediated Information eXchange (MIX), an XMPP protocol extension for the exchange of information among multiple users through a mediating service. The protocol can be used to provide human group communication and communication between non-human entities using channels, although with greater flexibility and extensibility than existing groupchat technologies such as Multi-User Chat (MUC). MIX uses Publish-Subscribe to provide flexible access and publication, and uses Message Archive Management (MAM) to provide storage and archiving.

last-revision.remark: Fix minor typo

xep.title: MUC presence versioning
xep.abstract: This specification defines a versioning mechanism which reduces the amount of presence traffic in a XEP-0045 MUC

last-revision.remark: Incorporate feedback from the standards list * Create a separate tag for sending the version number. * Include a reset token. * Remove the "Additional measures" section and merge parts into "Requirements". * Mandate that presences are always sent for affiliated users.

xep.title: vcard-temp
xep.abstract: This specification provides canonical documentation of the vCard-XML format currently in use within the Jabber community.

last-revision.remark: More fully specified error cases; added section on determining support.

xep.title: Pre-Authenticated Roster Subscription
xep.abstract: This document defines a protocol and URI scheme for pre-authenticated roster links that allow a third party to automatically obtain the user's presence subscription. The goal of this is to make onboarding of new XMPP IM contacts as easy as possible.

last-revision.remark: Cross-document editorial adjustments for inclusive language.

xep.title: Jingle XML Streams
xep.abstract: This specification defines a Jingle application type for establishing direct or mediated XML streams between two entities over any streaming transport. This technology thus enables two entities to establish a trusted connection for end-to-end encryption or for bypassing server limits on large volumes of XMPP traffic.

last-revision.remark: Adjusted text and examples to reflect Jingle-XTLS, Jingle-IBB, and Jingle-S5B; moved stream security to Jingle-XTLS; moved basic stream setup from XEP-0246 to this document; changed examples to use Jingle-IBB as the transport; clarified stream opening and closing as well as session termination.

xep.title: XMPP Over BOSH
xep.abstract: This specification defines how the Bidirectional-streams Over Synchronous HTTP (BOSH) technology can be used to transport XMPP stanzas. The result is an HTTP binding for XMPP communications that is useful in situations where a device or client is unable to maintain a long-lived TCP connection to an XMPP server.

last-revision.remark: Incorporated patches from community review.

xep.title: Jingle DTMF
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XML format for encapsulating Dual Tone Multi-Frequency (DTMF) events in informational messages sent within the context of Jingle audio sessions, e.g. to be used in the context of Interactive Voice Response (IVR) systems. Note well that this format is not to be used in the context of RTP sessions, where native RTP methods are to be used instead.

last-revision.remark: Corrected definitions and schema to make it clear that the code attribute contains one and only one character representing a DTMF tone.

xep.title: DMUC2: Distributed MUC
xep.abstract: Multi-User Chats, distributed over several nodes in the XMPP network, using a primary/replica architecture

last-revision.remark: Cross-document editorial adjustments for inclusive language.

xep.title: Jingle In-Band Bytestreams Transport Method
xep.abstract: This specification defines a Jingle transport method that results in sending data via the In-Band Bytestreams (IBB) protocol defined in XEP-0047. Essentially this transport method reuses XEP-0047 semantics for sending the data and defines native Jingle methods for starting and ending an IBB session.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the XMPP Council, advanced specification from Experimental to Draft.

xep.title: Verifying HTTP Requests via XMPP
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension that enables verification of an HTTP request via XMPP.

last-revision.remark: Mention a plaintext fallback.

xep.title: Rayo
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for the third-party control of telephone calls and other similar media sessions. The protocol includes support for session management/signaling, as well as advanced media resources such as speech recognizers, speech synthesizers and audio/video recorders. The protocol serves a different purpose from that of first-party protocols such as Jingle or SIP, and is compatible with those protocols.

last-revision.remark: Fix a bunch of typos, batch-style.

xep.title: XMPP Nodes
xep.abstract: This specification more clearly defines the nature of nodes as used in the Service Discovery and Publish-Subscribe extensions to the Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol (XMPP).

last-revision.remark: Initial published version; per Council discussion changed local to localpart.

xep.title: Encapsulated Digital Signatures in XMPP
xep.abstract: This document provides a technical specification for Encapsulated Digital Signatures in the Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol (XMPP).

last-revision.remark: Merge manifest and schema-desc objects.

xep.title: Jingle Early Media
xep.abstract: This specification describes methods for exchanging early media in the context of Jingle RTP sessions.

last-revision.remark: Initial version, copied from XEP-0167.

xep.title: Message Events
xep.abstract: This document defines an XMPP protocol extension used to request and respond to events relating to the delivery, display, and composition of messages. Note: This specification has been obsoleted in favor of XEP-0085 and XEP-0184.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the XMPP Council, changed status to Obsolete.

xep.title: Roster Versioning
xep.abstract: This specification defines a proposed modification to the XMPP roster protocol that enables versioning of rosters such that the server will not send the roster to the client if the roster has not been modified, thus saving bandwidth during session establishment.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the XMPP Council, changed status to Obsolete since roster versioning was folded into RFC 6121.

xep.title: Privacy Lists
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for enabling or disabling communication with other entities on a network. The protocol, which was first standardized in Section 10 of RFC 3921, can be used to block communication with unknown or undesirable entities. Blocking can be based on Jabber Identifier, subscription state, or roster group. The blocked stanzas can be messages, IQs, inbound or outbound presence stanzas, or all stanzas. The protocol also enables an entity to create, modify, or delete its privacy lists, apply different lists to different connected resources, define a default list, and decline the use of any privacy list during a particular communications session.

last-revision.remark: Deprecating by vote of the council.

xep.title: Dublin Core Infobits Mapping
xep.abstract: NOTE: This proposal was retracted by the author on 2004-02-19.

last-revision.remark: Confined proposal to Dublin Core only.

xep.title: Best practices for password hashing and storage
xep.abstract: This document outlines best practices for handling user passwords on the public Jabber network for both clients and servers.

last-revision.remark: Update to match draft-ietf-kitten-password-storage-01.

xep.title: Jabber Database Access
xep.abstract: Expose RDBM systems directly to the jabber network

last-revision.remark: At the request of the author, changed status to Retracted.

xep.title: Message Retraction
xep.abstract: This specification defines a method for indicating that a message should be retracted.

last-revision.remark: * Clarify when a service must advertise support via disco. * Add another service discovery URN for tombstones.

xep.title: Jingle File Transfer
xep.abstract: This specification defines a Jingle application type for transferring a file from one entity to another. The protocol provides a modular framework that enables the exchange of information about the file to be transferred as well as the negotiation of parameters such as the transport to be used.

last-revision.remark: Fix use of hash elements from XEP—0300.

xep.title: Event Logging over XMPP
xep.abstract: This specification provides a common framework for sending events to event logs over XMPP networks.

last-revision.remark: Defer due to lack of activity.

xep.title: Current Off-the-Record Messaging Usage
xep.abstract: This document outlines the current usage of Off-the-Record messaging in XMPP, its drawbacks, its strengths, and recommendations for improving the end user experience.

last-revision.remark: Fix broken link to Daniels article

xep.title: Packet Filtering
xep.abstract: A framework for packet filtering rules.

last-revision.remark: Cross-document editorial adjustments for inclusive language.

xep.title: Connection Transfer
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension that enables a server to redirect connections from one connection manager or server node to another.

last-revision.remark: Obsolete because this feature has been merged into XMPP core, see RFC6120 section 4.9.3.19, which describes the <see-other-host/> stream error.

xep.title: Jabber Search
xep.abstract: This specification provides canonical documentation of the jabber:iq:search namespace currently in use within the Jabber community.

last-revision.remark: Clarified that <first/> and <last/> elements in fact always represent given name and family name, respectively.

xep.title: Extensible SASL Profile
xep.abstract: This document describes a replacement for the SASL profile documented in RFC 6120 which allows for greater extensibility.

last-revision.remark: Defer due to lack of activity.

xep.title: Stanza Content Encryption
xep.abstract: The Stanza Content Encryption (SCE) protocol is intended as a way to allow clients to securely exchange arbitrary extension elements using different end-to-end encryption schemes.

last-revision.remark: Clarify bare JID usage and improve sentences: * Clarify usage of bare JIDs for affix elements * Improve and correct sentences about affix elements

xep.title: Jingle Raw UDP Transport Method
xep.abstract: This specification defines a Jingle transport method that results in sending media data using raw datagram associations via the User Datagram Protocol (UDP). This simple transport method does not provide NAT traversal, and the ICE-UDP transport method should be used if NAT traversal is required.

last-revision.remark: Made type optional in the schema (it’s a MAY in section 4.2), unlike in XEP-0176.

xep.title: Offline Encrypted Sessions
xep.abstract: This document specifies an end-to-end encryption protocol for offline XMPP communication sessions.

last-revision.remark: Added reference to Requirements for Encrypted Sessions; modified namespaces to reflect XMPP Registrar procedures regarding URN issuance.

xep.title: HTTP Authentication using Jabber Tickets
xep.abstract: This document defines a protocol for authenticating HTTP requests using Jabber Tickets.

last-revision.remark: Fix a bunch of typos, batch-style.

xep.title: Jingle SOCKS5 Bytestreams Transport Method
xep.abstract: This specification defines a Jingle transport method that results in sending data via the SOCKS5 Bytestreams (S5B) protocol defined in XEP-0065. Essentially this transport method reuses XEP-0065 semantics for sending the data and defines native Jingle methods for starting and ending an S5B session.

last-revision.remark: Replace broken link using archive.org

xep.title: Full Text Search in MAM
xep.abstract: This specification proposes a field in the MAM form for full text searching.

last-revision.remark: * No More Beer * Quasi-normative language around syntactic implementation

xep.title: DMUC1: Distributed Multi-User Chat
xep.abstract: This document defines methods for distributing Multi-User Chat (MUC) rooms across multiple chat services.

last-revision.remark: Added protocol flows for finding and joining shadow rooms, thus removing dependency on communication with firsthost; changed examples to mimic XEP-0045.

xep.title: Message Fancying
xep.abstract: This specification defines a Unicode-formatted fancy text syntax for use in instant messages.

last-revision.remark: Initial published version.

xep.title: Use of Entity Tags in XMPP Extensions
xep.abstract: This document defines best practices for the use of Entity Tags in XMPP extensions.

last-revision.remark: Added security considerations.

xep.title: Character counting in message bodies
xep.abstract: This document describes how to correctly count characters in message bodies. This is required when referencing a position in the body.

last-revision.remark: Include feedback/clarifications from list.

xep.title: Jingle HTTP Transport Method
xep.abstract: This specification defines two Jingle transport methods for establishing HTTP connections for either uploading or downloading data.

last-revision.remark: Defer due to lack of activity.

xep.title: Auto-Discovery of JabberIDs
xep.abstract: This specification defines a recommended best practice for linking to JabberIDs from documents hosted on the World Wide Web.

last-revision.remark: Initial published version.

xep.title: Cryptographic Design of Encrypted Sessions
xep.abstract: This document describes the cryptographic design that underpins the XMPP protocol extensions Encrypted Session Negotiation, Offline Encrypted Sessions and Stanza Encryption.

last-revision.remark: SIGMA-R negotiates both isPKA and isPKB fields

xep.title: The /me Command
xep.abstract: This specification defines recommended handling of the /me command in XMPP instant messaging clients.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the XMPP Council, advanced specification to Active and changed type from Historical to Informational.

xep.title: Data Forms Geolocation Element
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for including geolocation data in XEP-0004 data forms.

last-revision.remark: Defer due to lack of activity.

xep.title: Jabber Interest Groups
xep.abstract: This is the official list and summary information of the Jabber Interest Groups.

last-revision.remark: Changed Status to Obsolete per approval of XEP-0019.

xep.title: File Repository and Sharing
xep.abstract: While a protocol has been described for initiating a file transfer from one user to another, there is not yet a defined way for users to designate a set of files as available for retrieval by other users of their choosing. This extension defines a common syntax for this purpose which is based on PubSub Collections.

last-revision.remark: Fix incorrect reference to sipub namespace.

xep.title: Entity Capabilities
xep.abstract: This document defines an XMPP protocol extension for broadcasting and dynamically discovering client, device, or generic entity capabilities. In order to minimize network impact, the transport mechanism is standard XMPP presence broadcast (thus forestalling the need for polling related to service discovery data), the capabilities information can be cached either within a session or across sessions, and the format has been kept as small as possible.

last-revision.remark: Mention preimage attacks explicitly

xep.title: Push Notifications
xep.abstract: This specification defines a way for an XMPP servers to deliver information for use in push notifications to mobile and other devices.

last-revision.remark: Fix document-internal link

xep.title: Gateway Interaction
xep.abstract: This document specifies best practices for interactions between Jabber clients and client proxy gateways to legacy IM services.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the Jabber Council, advanced status to Active.

xep.title: Internet of Things - Concentrators
xep.abstract: Note: This specification has been retracted by the author; new implementations are not recommended. This specification describes how to manage and get information from concentrators of devices over XMPP networks.

last-revision.remark: Mark XEP as retracted by the author.

xep.title: Spoiler messages
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension that provides a method for indicating a message is a spoiler and should be displayed as such.

last-revision.remark: Defer due to lack of activity.

xep.title: Design Considerations for Digital Signatures in XMPP
xep.abstract: This document discusses considerations for the design of Digital Signatures in XMPP, including use cases and requirements. The document also discusses various ways XML Digital Signatures could be used in XMPP.

last-revision.remark: Fix a bunch of typos, batch-style.

xep.title: Pubsub Caching Hints
xep.abstract: This specification provides a way to get caching information from a Pubsub node

last-revision.remark: Accepted by vote of Council on 2021-07-21.

xep.title: Data Forms Layout
xep.abstract: This specification defines a backwards-compatible extension to the XMPP Data Forms protocol that enables an application to specify form layouts, including the layout of form fields, sections within pages, and subsections within sections.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the Jabber Council, advanced status to Draft.

xep.title: Bits of Binary
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for including or referring to small bits of binary data in an XML stanza.

last-revision.remark: Mention where to get textual names of hash functions.

xep.title: A Transport for Initiating and Negotiating Sessions (TINS)
xep.abstract: This document defined a SIP-compatible transport for initiating and negotiating sessions using SDP over XMPP.

last-revision.remark: Retracted in favor of Jingle (XEP-0166).

xep.title: Explicit Message Encryption
xep.abstract: This specification provides a way to mark encrypted messages so the recipient can discover how to decrypt it.

last-revision.remark: Add new OMEMO namespaces: * Add 'urn:xmpp:omemo:1' for OMEMO versions since 0.4.0 * Add 'urn:xmpp:omemo:2' for OMEMO versions since 0.8.0

xep.title: XMPP Client Compliance 2009
xep.abstract: This document defines XMPP client compliance levels for 2009.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the XMPP Council, advanced specification to Draft.

xep.title: User Physical Location
xep.abstract: This document defines a protocol for communicating information about the current physical location of a Jabber entity. NOTE WELL: The protocol defined herein has been folded into XEP-0080.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the Jabber Council, advanced status to Draft.

xep.title: Service Delegation
xep.abstract: This specification defines an approach for users to delegate certain services (e.g. pubsub) to alternative JIDs.

last-revision.remark: Initial published version.

xep.title: Jabber Event Notification Service (ENS)
xep.abstract: A generic publish-and-subscribe service for Jabber.

last-revision.remark: At the request of the author, the status of this document has been changed to Retracted since it has been superseded by XEP-0060.

xep.title: XPath Filtering
xep.abstract: A module that provides an XPath matching condition for packet filtering.

last-revision.remark: At the request of the author, changed the status of this document to Deferred pending development of an implementation; also changed the type to Informational.

xep.title: Virtual Presence
xep.abstract: This document proposes extensions to the Jabber groupchat protocol for virtual presence on Web pages.

last-revision.remark: Simplified VPI file and rule syntax, basically omitting the rule/search/replace tags.

xep.title: Public Key Publishing
xep.abstract: This specification defines a method by which an entity can publish its public keys over XMPP.

last-revision.remark: Defined an RSA-specific child element of the pubkey element to contain the modulus, public exponent, and fingerprint directly (rather than a DER-encoded format that depends on ASN.1); specified that the public exponent should be 65537; clarified the fingerprint generation method and updated all of the fingerprint formats to enable hash agility; incremented namespaces from version 1 to version 2.

xep.title: Whitespace Keepalive Negotiation
xep.abstract: This specification defines a method for negotiating how to send keepalives in XMPP.

last-revision.remark: Initial published version.

xep.title: File Sharing
xep.abstract: This document specifies a simple extension to existing protocols for file sharing over Jabber/XMPP.

last-revision.remark: Initial version.

xep.title: Conferencing SIG
xep.abstract: A proposal for a Jabber Interest Group that will discuss the protocol for implementing many-to-many communications.

last-revision.remark: Changed Status to Obsolete per approval of XEP-0019.

xep.title: User Nickname
xep.abstract: This specification defines a protocol for communicating user nicknames, either in XMPP presence subscription requests or in XMPP messages.

last-revision.remark: Based on implementation and deployment experience, discouraged use in Multi-User Chat; also removed text about Waiting Lists because of lack of deployment.

xep.title: Entity Versioning
xep.abstract: A method by which lists of items may be versioned so that servers will not need to send the entire list if it has not been modified, saving bandwidth and time with minimal state being stored by the server and client.

last-revision.remark: Spelling, tone, and grammar.

xep.title: Automatic Trust Management (ATM)
xep.abstract: This document specifies a way to automatically manage the trust in public long-term keys used by end-to-end encryption protocols.

last-revision.remark: Update to XEP-0434 version 0.6.0 and XEP-0384 version 0.8.0: * Use Base64-encoded key identifiers in examples * Update TM's namespace to 'urn:xmpp:tm:1' * Update OMEMO's namespace to 'urn:xmpp:omemo:2'

xep.title: Signaling WebRTC datachannels in Jingle
xep.abstract: This specification defines how to use the ICE-UDP Jingle transport method to send media data using WebRTC DataChannels, so technically uses DTLS/SCTP on top of the Interactive Connectivity Establishment (ICE) methodology, which provides robust NAT traversal for media traffic.

last-revision.remark: Fix attribute name (xmlns) in example

xep.title: COnferences with LIghtweight BRIdging (COLIBRI)
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP extension that allows real-time communications clients to discover and interact with conference bridges that provide conference mixing or relaying capabilities.

last-revision.remark: Defer due to lack of activity.

xep.title: Encapsulating Digital Signatures in XMPP
xep.abstract: This document provides a technical specification for Encapsulating Digital Signatures in the Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol (XMPP).

last-revision.remark: Change title, and clarify in text, that this is an encapulating digital signature approach, an alternative to the encapulated digitial signatures proposal.

xep.title: Namespace Delegation
xep.abstract: This specification provides a way for XMPP server to delegate treatments for a namespace to an other entity

last-revision.remark: * delegation of * delegation of * about disco requests * namespace bump * typos

xep.title: SOAP Over XMPP
xep.abstract: This specification defines methods for transporting SOAP messages over XMPP. Although the protocol supports only the request-response message exchange pattern, the protocol is formally defined as a SOAP Protocol Binding in accordance with version 1.2 of the W3C SOAP specification. In addition, a WSDL definition is defined for the purpose of advertising the availability of this protocol binding.

last-revision.remark: Fix incorrect reference to sipub namespace.

xep.title: Basic Filtering Operations
xep.abstract: A module that provides basic conditions and actions for packet filtering.

last-revision.remark: At the request of the author, changed the status of this document to Deferred pending development of an implementation; also changed the type to Informational.

xep.title: User Chatting
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for communicating information about the chatrooms a user visits.

last-revision.remark: Modified namespace in accordance with protocol versioning policies.

xep.title: iCal Envelope
xep.abstract: A simple mechanism to transport iCal data over the jabber protocol

last-revision.remark: Initial draft (jk).

xep.title: Software Version
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for retrieving information about the software application associated with an XMPP entity. The protocol enables one entity to explicitly query another entity, where the response can include the name of the software application, the version of the software application, and the operating system on which the application is running.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the XMPP Council, changed from Historical and Active to Standards Track and Draft; recommended use of Entity Capabilities instead of Software Version when presence information is available; added proviso to security considerations regarding disclosure of operating system information; added section on Service Discovery.

xep.title: File Transfer
xep.abstract: A protocol for transferring a file between two Jabber IDs.

last-revision.remark: Fix a bunch of typos, batch-style.

xep.title: Out of Band Data
xep.abstract: This specification defines two XMPP protocol extensions for communicating URIs, one for use in XMPP message stanzas and the other for use in a structured request-response interaction via XMPP IQ stanzas. Among other things, this enables one entity to inform another entity about a file that is available at an HTTP URL.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the Jabber Council, converted to Standards Track.

xep.title: Codecs for Jingle Video
xep.abstract: This document describes implementation considerations related to video codecs for use in Jingle RTP sessions.

last-revision.remark: Initial published version, split from XEP-0266.

xep.title: Special Interests Group End to End Encryption
xep.abstract: This document proposes the formation of a Special Interest Group (SIG) within the XSF devoted to the development of end-to-end encryption within the context of XMPP.

last-revision.remark: Add discussion venue after creation by the Infrastructure Team.

xep.title: User Mood
xep.abstract: This specification defines a payload format for communicating information about user moods, such as whether a person is currently happy, sad, angy, or annoyed. The payload format is typically transported using the personal eventing protocol, a profile of XMPP publish-subscribe specified in XEP-0163.

last-revision.remark: Changed the namespace of an example of proprietary extensibility.

xep.title: Stream Initiation
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for initiating a data stream between any two XMPP entities. The protocol includes the ability to include metadata about the stream and provides a pluggable framework so that various profiles of stream initiation can be defined for particular use cases (such as file transfer).

last-revision.remark: Deprecated by vote of the council.

xep.title: XMPP Compliance Suites 2012
xep.abstract: This document defines XMPP protocol compliance levels for 2012.

last-revision.remark: Initial published version.

xep.title: IM Routing-NG
xep.abstract: This specification provides a new set of routing rules for modern instant messaging.

last-revision.remark: Accepted by vote of Council on 2018-04-11.

xep.title: Shared Notes
xep.abstract: A simplistic mechanism for shared notes, modeled after common stickie note applications.

last-revision.remark: At the request of the author, changed the status of this document to Deferred pending development of an implementation; also changed the type to Informational.

xep.title: Software Information
xep.abstract: This document specifies an extended data format whereby XMPP service discovery responses can include detailed information about the software application that powers a given XMPP entity for includion in service discovery responses.

last-revision.remark: Per Last Call feedback, removed icons for presence states; redefined the icon field to use media element per XEP-0221.

xep.title: Infobits
xep.abstract: NOTE: This proposal was retracted by the author on 2004-02-19.

last-revision.remark: Clarified rationale for not using namespaces; added bundles; added dataype attribute for <bit/> elements; added Matt Miller as co-author.

xep.title: Server Buddies
xep.abstract: This specification defines a convention for presence subscriptions between XMPP servers.

last-revision.remark: Corrected several examples and points in the text.

xep.title: Stateless file sharing
xep.abstract: This specification describes a protocol for stateless asynchronous file sharing with integrity and transport flexibility. It allows clients to provide a good interoperable user experience in combination with Carbons and MAM.

last-revision.remark: Add disposition attribute to signal when inlining is desired.

xep.title: Service Discovery Notifications
xep.abstract: This specification defines a method for requesting and receiving notifications regarding XMPP service discovery items.

last-revision.remark: Add forgotten node attribute in example 2.

xep.title: Private XML Storage
xep.abstract: This specification provides canonical documentation of the 'jabber:iq:private' namespace currently in common usage.

last-revision.remark: Corrected several errors in the text; specified security considerations.

xep.title: Requirements for Encrypted Sessions
xep.abstract: This document describes the requirements for an XMPP end-to-end encrypted session protocol.

last-revision.remark: Clarified introduction.

xep.title: PubSub Collection Nodes
xep.abstract: This specification defines the nature and handling of collection nodes in the XMPP publish-subscribe extension.

last-revision.remark: Revert change from version 0.2.1 which changed meta-data to metadata in wire protocol. That was an unintended breaking change which has now been reverted.

xep.title: WebDAV File Transfers
xep.abstract: This document specifies a method for completing file transfers between XMPP entities using WebDAV.

last-revision.remark: Corrected to reflect changes to XEP-0070; incorporated WedDAV feedback.

xep.title: Extended Presence Protocol Suite
xep.abstract: This document specifies a set of XMPP extensions that provide support for extended presence information.

last-revision.remark: Retracted: superseded by Personal Eventing via Pubsub (XEP-0163).

xep.title: Internet of Things - Provisioning
xep.abstract: Note: This specification has been retracted by the author; new implementations are not recommended. This specification describes an architecture for efficient provisioning of services, access rights and user privileges in for the Internet of Things, where communication between Things is done using the XMPP protocol.

last-revision.remark: Cross-document editorial adjustments for inclusive language.

xep.title: Jabber OOB Broadcast Service (JOBS)
xep.abstract: A protocol for enabling uni-directional multicast data transfers out of band.

last-revision.remark: At the request of the author, changed status to Retracted.

xep.title: Moved
xep.abstract: This document defines an XMPP protocol extension that enables a user to inform its contacts about a change in JID.

last-revision.remark: Re-write the flow with a more focused approach.

xep.title: Message Reactions
xep.abstract: This specification defines a way for adding reactions to a message.

last-revision.remark: Accepted by vote of Council on 2020-10-07.

xep.title: Common Alerting Protocol (CAP) Over XMPP
xep.abstract: This document specifies a method for sending Common Alerting Protocol (CAP) data over XMPP.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the Jabber Council, advanced status to Active.

xep.title: Guidelines for Authors of XMPP Extension Protocols
xep.abstract: This document provides information intended to assist authors of XMPP Extension Protocols.

last-revision.remark: Reflect preference for GitHub pull requests to maintain existing XEPs; update terminology to refer to XMPP Extensions Editor team.

xep.title: Out-of-Band Stream Data
xep.abstract: This specification defines how to send parts of an XML stream over a direct connection between peers. This allows to send large stanzas or binary data without blocking the XML stream for other stanzas.

last-revision.remark: Initial published version.

xep.title: Current Jabber OpenPGP Usage
xep.abstract: This document outlines the current usage of OpenPGP for messaging and presence.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the XMPP Council, changed status from Active to Deprecated to Obsolete.

xep.title: Bookmarks
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XML data format for use by XMPP clients in storing bookmarks to mult-user chatrooms and web pages. The chatroom bookmarking function includes the ability to auto-join rooms on login.

last-revision.remark: Deprecate in favour of XEP-0402

xep.title: Proposed Resource Binding Improvements
xep.abstract: This document proposes improvements to the definition of resource binding for inclusion in the specification that supersedes RFC 3920.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the XMPP Council, changed status from Deprecated to Obsolete.

xep.title: Privileged Entity
xep.abstract: This specification provides a way for XMPP entities to have a privileged access to some other entities data

last-revision.remark: * Add "iq" privilege (necessary to implement XEPs such as ). * Roster pushes are now transmitted to privileged entity with "roster" permission of "get" or "both". This can be disabled. * Reformulate to specify than only initial stanza and "unavailable" stanzas are transmitted with "presence" pemission. * Namespace bump.

xep.title: User Activity
xep.abstract: This specification defines a payload format for communicating information about user activities, such as whether a person is currently working, travelling, or relaxing. The payload format is typically transported using the personal eventing protocol, a profile of XMPP publish-subscribe specified in XEP-0163.

last-revision.remark: Allowed empty activity element to signify a pause in publishing; added undefined element to handle any unspecified activity; also added more activities: dancing, fishing, hiding, praying, smoking, thinking.

xep.title: Jingle Telepathy Transport
xep.abstract: This document defines a telepathic transport method for establishing Extra-Sensory Perception (ESP) streams.

last-revision.remark: April Fools!

xep.title: SSL/TLS Integration
xep.abstract: NOTE WELL: this specification was retracted on 2003-11-05 since the topic is addressed definitively in XMPP Core. Please refer to XMPP Core for further information.

last-revision.remark: The status of this specification has been changed to Retracted since it has been superseded by XMPP Core.

xep.title: ECO-XMPP
xep.abstract: This specification defines best practices and protocol modifications that will reduce the energy consumption of XMPP systems and thereby help to save the planet.

last-revision.remark: April Fools!

xep.title: File Information Sharing
xep.abstract: This document specifies a simple extension to existing protocols that allows an entity to request information about files.

last-revision.remark: Fix example 7, remove superfluous 'node' attribute

xep.title: Client Webtabs
xep.abstract: A protocol for displaying web-based tabs in clients.

last-revision.remark: Added Terminology section and associated alterations and added clarification about what the webtabs are.

xep.title: SASL Integration
xep.abstract: NOTE WELL: this specification was retracted on 2003-11-05 since the topic is addressed definitively in XMPP Core. Please refer to XMPP Core for further information.

last-revision.remark: The status of this specification has been changed to Retracted since it has been superseded by XMPP Core.

xep.title: User Avatar
xep.abstract: This document defines an XMPP protocol extension for exchanging user avatars, which are small images or icons associated with human users. The protocol specifies payload formats for both avatar metadata and the image data itself. The payload formats are typically transported using the personal eventing profile of XMPP publish-subscribe as specified in XEP-0163.

last-revision.remark: Use xs:unsignedInt for bytes, the previous revision introduced xs:unsignedInteger which isn’t a valid XML Schema data type.

xep.title: Mediated Information eXchange (MIX): Miscellaneous Capabilities
xep.abstract: This document defines an extension to Mediated Information eXchange (MIX) specified in XEP-0369. It specifies a number of independent optional capabilities that MAY be used with MIX.

last-revision.remark: Fix various typos

xep.title: Reliable Entity Link
xep.abstract: Protocol for linking a bytestream between two Jabber entities.

last-revision.remark: At the request of the author, the status of this specification has been changed to Retracted since it has been superseded by XEP-0065.

xep.title: Consistent Color Generation
xep.abstract: This specification provides a set of algorithms to consistently generate colors given a string. The string can be a nickname, a JID or any other piece of information. All entities adhering to this specification generate the same color for the same string, which provides a consistent user experience across platforms.

last-revision.remark: Remove Color Vision Deficiency correction algorithms and substitute them with a better recommendation.

xep.title: A Framework For Securing Jabber Conversations
xep.abstract: Although the value and utility of contemporary instant messaging systems, like Jabber, are now indisputable, current security features to protect message data are generally inadequate for many deployments; this is particularly true in security conscious environments like large, commercial enterprises and government agencies. These current features suffer from issues of scalability, usability, and supported features. Furthermore, there is a lack of standardization. We present a protocol to allow communities of Jabber users to apply cryptographic protection to selected conversation data.

last-revision.remark: updated to reflect group consensus to incorporate XML Encryption, as well as other group comments from Draft 0.9.

xep.title: Rayo Fax
xep.abstract: This specification defines an extension to the Rayo protocol (XEP-0327) to provide provision for sending and receiving faxcimilies via a call under the control of a Rayo client.

last-revision.remark: Fix a bunch of typos, batch-style.

xep.title: Quick Response
xep.abstract: Quickly respond to automated messages.

last-revision.remark: Accepted by vote of Council on 2020-04-22.

xep.title: Simple Access Control
xep.abstract: A simple protocol for querying information for permissions.

last-revision.remark: At the request of the author, changed status to Retracted.

xep.title: Resource Application Priority
xep.abstract: This document defines an XMPP protocol extension to indicate the presence priority of XMPP resources for applications other than standard XMPP messaging.

last-revision.remark: * More clearly defined the meaning of "application type". * Modified namespaces to incorporate namespace versioning.

xep.title: Message Attaching
xep.abstract: This specification defines a method for indicating that a message contains content which describes an earlier message in the conversation and should be grouped with the earlier message.

last-revision.remark: Update to use unique stanza ids.

xep.title: Stateless Inline Media Sharing (SIMS)
xep.abstract: This specification describes a protocol for stateless asynchronous media sharing with integrity and transport flexibility. It allows clients to provide a good interoperable user experience in combination with Carbons and MAM.

last-revision.remark: Fix reference to XEP-0234.

xep.title: Fallback Indication
xep.abstract: This specification proposes a mechanism by which message bodies can be marked as being purely for fallback purposes, and therefore to be ignored by intermediaries and anything that understands the remainder of the message.

last-revision.remark: Minor editorial fixes

xep.title: XMPP Eventing via Pubsub
xep.abstract: This document specifies semantics for using the XMPP publish-subscribe protocol to handle generic XMPP events (including presence, one-to-one messaging, and groupchat).

last-revision.remark: April Fools!

xep.title: OAuth Over XMPP
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP extension for delegating access to protected resources over XMPP, using the OAuth protocol.

last-revision.remark: Changed protocol namespace from urn:xmpp:tmp:oauth to urn:xmpp:oauth:0 to conform to XMPP Registrar policies; clarified protocol flow and error handling; corrected examples.

xep.title: Tree Transfer Stream Initiation Profile
xep.abstract: A profile describing metadata for transferring trees of files using stream inititation.

last-revision.remark: Fix a bunch of typos, batch-style.

xep.title: Service Discovery
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for discovering information about other XMPP entities. Two kinds of information can be discovered: (1) the identity and capabilities of an entity, including the protocols and features it supports; and (2) the items associated with an entity, such as the list of rooms hosted at a multi-user chat service.

last-revision.remark: XML schema modified so that no ordering is required between disco#info children.

xep.title: Use of Cryptographic Hash Functions in XMPP
xep.abstract: This document provides a common wire format for the transport of cryptographic hash function references and hash function values in XMPP protocol extensions.

last-revision.remark: Advance to Draft as per 2019-09-19 Council vote

xep.title: Spim-Blocking Control
xep.abstract: This document defines an XMPP protocol extension that enables clients to control how their servers may block spim that is addressed to them. It specifies a default privacy list fall-through action.

last-revision.remark: Updated to reflect move of privacy rules to XEP-0016; modified provisional namespaces to adhere to XMPP Registrar policies; completed editorial review.

xep.title: In-Band Bytestreams
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension that enables any two entities to establish a one-to-one bytestream between themselves, where the data is broken down into smaller chunks and transported in-band over XMPP.

last-revision.remark: Fix incorrect max sequence number in the text; it was given as one less than two to the power of 15, but in reality it is one less than two to the power of 16, which is clear from the context).

xep.title: Message Markup
xep.abstract: This specification provides an alternative to XHTML-IM with rigid separation of content and markup information, improving the resilience against spoofing and injection attacks.

last-revision.remark: Adopt deferred XEP.

xep.title: Last Activity in Presence
xep.abstract: This specification defines a way to use the Last Activity extension in XMPP presence notifications.

xep.title: Recipient Server Side Notifications Filtering
xep.abstract: This specification defines a modern efficient way to deliver PubSub notifications.

last-revision.remark: Defer due to lack of activity.

xep.title: Best Practices for Use of SASL ANONYMOUS
xep.abstract: This document specifies best practices for use of the SASL ANONYMOUS mechanism in the context of client authentication with an XMPP server.

last-revision.remark: Provided more detailed recommendations regarding usage restrictions for anonymous users, including the concept of different deployment types; added note about the account/anonymous service discovery identity.

xep.title: Message Moderation
xep.abstract: This specification defines a method for groupchat moderators to moderate messages.

last-revision.remark: Typographical fix

xep.title: Jingle Encrypted Transports
xep.abstract: This specification defines a method that allows to use established encryption schemes for end-to-end encryption of Jingle transports.

xep.title: Message Carbons
xep.abstract: In order to keep all IM clients for a user engaged in a conversation, outbound messages are carbon-copied to all interested resources.
