xep.title: In-Band Real Time Text
xep.abstract: This is a specification for real-time text transmitted in-band over an XMPP session. Real-time text is text transmitted instantly while it is being typed or created.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the XMPP Council, advanced status to Draft.

xep.title: Mediated Information eXchange (MIX): Co-existence with MUC
xep.abstract: This document defines an extension to Mediated Information eXchange (MIX) specified in XEP-0369. It specifies how MIX and MUC can be operated together.

last-revision.remark: Fix reference to MIX-CORE namespaces

xep.title: Stanza Headers and Internet Metadata
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for representing non-address-related headers in an XML format that is appropriate for use in XMPP. While the protocol provides a flexible mechanism for representing many kinds of standard Internet metadata, a registry of values is defined to structure the possible range of headers, and the inital registration includes headers from email, HTTP, MIME, and SIP.

last-revision.remark: Added Urgency header from registry.

xep.title: Bidirectional Server-to-Server Connections
xep.abstract: This specification defines a protocol for using server-to-server connections in a bidirectional way such that stanzas are sent and received on the same TCP connection.

last-revision.remark: Fix syntax highlighting and tweak example formatting.

xep.title: File metadata element
xep.abstract: This specification defines a generic file metadata element to be used in other specifications.

xep.title: vCard Infobits Mapping
xep.abstract: NOTE: This proposal was retracted by the author on 2004-02-19.

xep.title: Roster Item Exchange
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for exchanging contact list items, including the ability to suggest whether the item is to be added, deleted, or modified in the contact list of the recipient, as well as the suggested roster group for the item.

last-revision.remark: Fix JID example

xep.title: Extended Stanza Addressing
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension that enables entities to include RFC822-style address headers within XMPP stanzas in order to specify multiple recipients or sub-addresses.

last-revision.remark: Clarify Reply Handling, add 'ofrom' type and fix examples

xep.title: XMPP Protocol Flows for Inter-Domain Federation
xep.abstract: This specification provides detailed protocol flows for the establishment of communication between domains that provide XMPP services, including permutations for a wide variety of possible federation policies.

last-revision.remark: Initial published version.

xep.title: Personal Eventing Protocol
xep.abstract: This specification defines semantics for using the XMPP publish-subscribe protocol to broadcast state change events associated with an instant messaging and presence account. This profile of pubsub therefore enables a standard XMPP user account to function as a virtual pubsub service, easing the discovery of syndicated data and event notifications associated with such an account.

last-revision.remark: Add comma and fix typo

xep.title: Internet of Things - Sensor Data
xep.abstract: Note: This specification has been retracted by the author; new implementations are not recommended. This specification provides the common framework for sensor data interchange over XMPP networks.

last-revision.remark: Mark XEP as retracted by the author.

xep.title: Publish-Subscribe
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for generic publish-subscribe functionality. The protocol enables XMPP entities to create nodes (topics) at a pubsub service and publish information at those nodes; an event notification (with or without payload) is then broadcasted to all entities that have subscribed to the node. Pubsub therefore adheres to the classic Observer design pattern and can serve as the foundation for a wide variety of applications, including news feeds, content syndication, rich presence, geolocation, workflow systems, network management systems, and any other application that requires event notifications.

last-revision.remark: Add hint for processing incomplete submission forms

xep.title: Server IP Check
xep.abstract: This specification defines a simple XMPP extension that enables a client to discover its external IP address.

last-revision.remark: Modified XML format so server can return port as well as IP address; incremented protocol version from 0 to 1.

xep.title: Shared XML Editing
xep.abstract: This specification defines a protocol that enables two or more endpoints to collaboratively edit an XML object. The protocol is intended for use mainly over the Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol (XMPP), either by existing instant messaging clients or by specialized editing clients. However, the protocol could also be used over a direct TCP connection rather than over XMPP.

last-revision.remark: Cross-document editorial adjustments for inclusive language.

xep.title: Publishing Stream Initiation Requests
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension that enables an XMPP entity to advertise the fact that it is willing accept a particular Stream Initiation request. The protocol is used mainly to inform other entities that a particular file is available for transfer via the File Transfer protocol defined in XEP-0096.

last-revision.remark: Deprecated per a vote of the XMPP Council.

xep.title: Chat Markers
xep.abstract: This specification describes a solution of marking the last received, displayed and acknowledged message in a chat.

last-revision.remark: Add notes about usage within MUCs.

xep.title: Codecs for Jingle Audio
xep.abstract: This document describes implementation considerations related to audio codecs for use in Jingle RTP sessions.

last-revision.remark: Updated to reflect standardization of the Opus codec; changed client conformance to also recommend (but not require) support for Opus.

xep.title: XHTML-IM
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XHTML 1.0 Integration Set for use in exchanging instant messages that contain lightweight text markup. The protocol enables an XMPP entity to format a message using a small range of commonly-used HTML elements, attributes, and style properties that are suitable for use in instant messaging. The protocol also excludes HTML constructs that may introduce malware and other vulnerabilities (such as scripts and objects) for improved security.

last-revision.remark: Correction: Council voted to Deprecate, not Obsolete.

xep.title: XMPP Compliance Suites 2020
xep.abstract: This document defines XMPP application categories for different use cases (Core, Web, IM, and Mobile), and specifies the required XEPs that client and server software needs to implement for compliance with the use cases.

xep.title: Jabber MIME Type

xep.title: Simple JSON Messaging
xep.abstract: This specification proposes a simple mechanism by which applications can transfer data safely, without needing additional protocol design work. It is intended to provide a protocol that is trivial to implement and can be driven with a simple API.

xep.title: Reminders
xep.abstract: This specification provides a way to set up reminders.

last-revision.remark: Accepted by vote of Council on 2020-03-04.

xep.abstract: A publish-subscribe protocol for Jabber.

last-revision.remark: At the request of the authors, the status of this document has been changed to Retracted since it has been superseded by XEP-0060.

xep.title: Last Activity
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for communicating information about the last activity associated with an XMPP entity. It is typically used by an IM client to retrieve the most recent presence information from an offline contact by sending a last activity request to the server that hosts the account controlled by the contact.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the XMPP Council, advanced specification to Final; clarified a few small points in the text; added a reference to XEP-0115.

xep.title: Bookmark Pinning
xep.abstract: This document defines an XMPP protocol extension to allow users to pin PEP Native Bookmarks.

xep.title: Best Practices for Use of SASL EXTERNAL with Certificates
xep.abstract: This document specifies best practices for XMPP usage of the SASL EXTERNAL mechanism in the context of PKIX certificates.

xep.title: References
xep.abstract: This document defines a method for one XMPP stanza to provide references to another entity, such as mentioning users, HTTP resources, or other XMPP resources.

last-revision.remark: Specify counting should be of code points.

xep.title: Multi-User Text Editing
xep.abstract: This document defines how several people may simultaneously edit text.

last-revision.remark: Initial version.

xep.title: User Viewing
xep.abstract: This document defines an XMPP protocol extension for communicating information about the television shows, movies, or other videos that a user watches.

last-revision.remark: Modified namespace in accordance with protocol versioning policies.

xep.title: Microblogging over XMPP
xep.abstract: This specification defines a method for microblogging over XMPP.

xep.abstract: This document describes the XMPP Standard Foundation's Code of Conduct

last-revision.remark: Integrate various comments from various sources

xep.title: Commenting
xep.abstract: This specification defines a method for commenting.

xep.abstract: This document defines a protocol to query and control an archive of messages stored on a server.

xep.title: XMPP Compliance Suites 2021
xep.abstract: This document defines XMPP application categories for different use cases (Core, Web, IM, and Mobile), and specifies the required XEPs that client and server software needs to implement for compliance with the use cases.

last-revision.remark: Accept as Draft as per Council vote from 2020-11-11.

xep.title: Jingle Relay Nodes
xep.abstract: This documents specifies how Jingle Clients can interact with Jingle Relay Nodes Services and how XMPP entities can provide, search and list available Jingle Relay Nodes.

last-revision.remark: Cross-document editorial adjustments for inclusive language.

xep.title: MAM Fastening Collation
xep.abstract: This specification proposes a mechanism by which MAM results containing fastenings can be collated effectively.

xep.title: Generic Maps
xep.abstract: A protocol for transport of generic maps (graphical displays of specific subsets of buddies).

last-revision.remark: Initial version.

xep.title: Stanza Session Negotiation
xep.abstract: This specification defines a method for formally negotiating the exchange of XML stanzas between two XMPP entities. The method uses feature negotiation forms sent via XMPP message stanzas to enable session initiation between entities that do not share presence information or have knowledge of full JabberIDs and therefore is also suitable for use across gateways to SIP-based systems. A wide range of session parameters can be negotiated, including the use of end-to-end encryption, chat state notifications, XHTML-IM formatting, and message archiving.

last-revision.remark: Update missing 'xmppsipim' reference to RFC 7572.

xep.title: Spim Markers and Reports
xep.abstract: This document defines an XMPP protocol extension that enables XMPP entities to interact with spim filters by marking unsolicited or suspicious XMPP stanzas.

last-revision.remark: Initial published version.

xep.title: External Service Discovery
xep.abstract: This document specifies an XMPP protocol extension for discovering services external to the XMPP network.

last-revision.remark: Accept as Stable as per Council Vote from 2022-08-03.

xep.title: MUC Mention Notifications
xep.abstract: This specification documents how a user may be informed when they're mentioned in a MUC which they're not currently joined to.

last-revision.remark: Fix addresses in example

xep.title: Mobile Considerations on LTE Networks
xep.abstract: This document provides background information for XMPP implementors concerned with mobile devices operating on an LTE cellular network.

last-revision.remark: Advance to Active as per Council vote on 2018-01-10.

xep.title: JID Escaping
xep.abstract: This specification defines a mechanism that enables the display in Jabber Identifiers (JIDs) of characters normally disallowed in localparts. Although these characters spaces, double quote, ampersand, single quote, forward slash, colon, less than, greater than, and at-sign cannot be included in XMPP localparts, JID Escaping provides a native XMPP escaping mechanism for these characters so that the displayed version of a Jabber Identifier can appear to include these characters. This mechanism can also be used to translate non-XMPP addreses into XMPP syntax, for example when gatewaying between XMPP and a non-XMPP communications technology such as email.

last-revision.remark: Update references to the node identifier to localpart, replace stringprep references with PRECIS, and update JID RFC references.

xep.title: Naive Packet Framing Protocol
xep.abstract: An intermediate method for more efficient framing of the Jabber XML Stream.

last-revision.remark: Continued improvement and specification.

xep.title: Out-of-Office Messages
xep.abstract: This document defines an XMPP protocol extension for communicating out-of-office status.

last-revision.remark: Fix not well-formed XML in example.

xep.title: Nested Roster Groups
xep.abstract: This document defines an XMPP protocol extension that enables nested sub-groups to exist within the Jabber roster, while retaining backwards compatibility and ensuring that the roster remains usable by all clients.

xep.title: Jabber Component Protocol
xep.abstract: This specification documents the existing protocol used for communication between servers and "external" components over the Jabber network.

xep.title: Service Discovery Extensions

xep.title: Jingle
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for initiating and managing peer-to-peer media sessions between two XMPP entities in a way that is interoperable with existing Internet standards. The protocol provides a pluggable model that enables the core session management semantics (compatible with SIP) to be used for a wide variety of application types (e.g., voice chat, video chat, file transfer) and with a wide variety of transport methods (e.g., TCP, UDP, ICE, application-specific transports).

xep.title: OpenPGP for XMPP Instant Messaging
xep.abstract: Specifies a OpenPGP for XMPP (XEP-0373) profile for the Instant Messaging (IM) use case.

xep.title: Entity Time
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for communicating the local time of an entity, including the time in UTC according to the entity as well as the offset from UTC. The time format itself conforms to the dateTime profile of ISO 8601 defined in XEP-0082.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the XMPP Council, advanced specification from Draft to Final.

xep.title: Generic Alerts
xep.abstract: A protocol for generic alerts (similar to .NET Alerts service).

last-revision.remark: Changed element from x to alert.

xep.title: Entity Reputation
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for communicating the reputation of any entity on the network.

xep.title: Stanza Interception and Filtering Technology (SIFT)
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension that enables a client to exercise control over the XML stanzas it will receive from the server by instructing the server to intercept and filter inbound stanzas.

last-revision.remark: Made it clear that presence means presence notifications; added support for subscription-related presence stanzas; described payload matching in greater detail; added use case for allowing only core XMPP child elements; increased protocol version number from 1 to 2.

xep.title: Account Transfer
xep.abstract: A proposal for enabling the ability to transfer an account from one Jabber server to another.

last-revision.remark: Cleaned up the open issues and concerns section.

xep.title: Jingle ICE-UDP Transport Method
xep.abstract: This specification defines a Jingle transport method that results in sending media data using raw datagram associations via the User Datagram Protocol (UDP). This transport method is negotiated via the Interactive Connectivity Establishment (ICE) methodology, which provides robust NAT traversal for media traffic.

last-revision.remark: Cross-document editorial adjustments for inclusive language.

xep.title: Chat State Notifications
xep.abstract: This document defines an XMPP protocol extension for communicating the status of a user in a chat session, thus indicating whether a chat partner is actively engaged in the chat, composing a message, temporarily paused, inactive, or gone. The protocol can be used in the context of a one-to-one chat session or a multi-user chat room.

last-revision.remark: Clarified that any state change is allowed.

xep.title: PubSub Chaining
xep.abstract: This specification defines a method for chaining pubsub nodes together, resulting in lightweight repeaters for pubsub notifications.

last-revision.remark: Specifed protocol flow for the chained subscription.

xep.title: Metacontacts
xep.abstract: This document specifies an XMPP protocol extension for defining metacontacts and grouping member JIDs.

last-revision.remark: Initial published version.

xep.title: SASL Channel-Binding Type Capability
xep.abstract: This specification allows servers to annouce their supported SASL channel-binding types to clients.

last-revision.remark: Make implementation of tls-server-end-point a MUST for servers.

xep.title: Jingle Message Initiation
xep.abstract: This specification provides a way for the initiator of a Jingle session to propose sending an invitation in an XMPP message stanza, thus taking advantage of message delivery semantics instead of sending IQ stanzas to all of the responder's online resources or choosing a particular online resource.

last-revision.remark: * Rework whole spec, namespace bump * Add new <finish/> message * Add dependency on , and * Add <reason/> to some messages

xep.title: Extensible Status Conditions for Multi-User Chat
xep.abstract: This document defines an extensible format for status conditions in Multi-User Chat, similar to the error format used in the core of XMPP.

last-revision.remark: Fix broken example XML.

xep.title: Best Practices to Discourage JID Mimicking
xep.abstract: This document recommends best practices to discourage mimicking of Jabber IDs.

last-revision.remark: Added security consideration about storage of handle in the roster.

xep.title: Contact Addresses for XMPP Services
xep.abstract: This document defines a method for specifying contact addresses related to an XMPP service.

last-revision.remark: Cross-document editorial adjustments for inclusive language.

xep.title: Requirements for Shared Editing
xep.abstract: This document defines requirements for the design of XMPP-based shared editing protocols.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Message Styling
xep.abstract: This specification defines a formatted text syntax for use in instant messages with simple text styling.

xep.abstract: This specification allows to change order of items retrieval in a Pubsub or MAM query

xep.title: Publishing Available Jingle Sessions
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension that enables an XMPP entity to advertise the fact that it is willing accept a particular Jingle session request. The protocol is used mainly to inform other entities that a particular file is available for transfer via the Jingle File Transfer protocol defined in XEP-0234.

last-revision.remark: Defer due to lack of activity.

xep.title: XMPP Compliance Suites 2022

xep.title: Bookmarks Conversion
xep.abstract: This specification describes a method to migrate to PEP based bookmarks without loosing compatibility with client that still use Private XML.

xep.title: User Profile
xep.abstract: This document specifies how to represent and manage profile data about IM users and other XMPP entities using the XMPP Data Forms extension.

last-revision.remark: Cross-document editorial adjustments for inclusive language.

xep.title: Mediated Information eXchange (MIX): Participant Server Requirements
xep.abstract: This document defines an extension to Mediated Information eXchange (MIX) specified in XEP-0369. It specifies behaviour of an XMPP server to which MIX Clients connect in order to enable correct operation of these clients in conjunction with a MIX server.

last-revision.remark: Clarify that later roster requests reset the state of the annotation setting

xep.title: Result Set Management
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension that enables an entity to page through and otherwise manage the receipt of large result sets. The protocol can be used in the context of any XMPP protocol that might send large result sets (such as service discovery, multi-user chat, and publish-subscribe). While the requesting entity in such an interaction can explicitly request the use of result set management, an indication that result set management is in use can also be proactively included by the responding entity when returning a limited result set in response to a query.

last-revision.remark: Per a vote of the Jabber Council, advanced status to Draft.

xep.title: Unique and Stable Stanza IDs
xep.abstract: This specification describes unique and stable IDs for messages.

xep.title: CAPTCHA Forms
xep.abstract: This document specifies an XMPP protocol extension that entities may use to discover whether the sender of an XML stanza is a human user or a robot.

xep.title: XMPP Over RELOAD (XOR)
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP Usage of REsource LOcation And Discovery (RELOAD). The XMPP usage provides an ability for XMPP clients to discover other peers' location through the peer-to-peer overlay. Once a peer location is determined, the RELOAD AppAttach method is used to establish a direct connection between peers through which XMPP streams are exchanged.

last-revision.remark: Accepted by vote of Council on 2019-02-27.

xep.title: XMPP Registrar Function
xep.abstract: This document defines the roles and processes of the XMPP Registrar function within the XMPP Standards Foundation.

xep.title: MUC Eventing Protocol
xep.abstract: This specification defines semantics for using the XMPP publish-subscribe protocol to broadcast state change events associated with a Multi-User Chat (MUC) room. This profile of pubsub therefore enables a chatroom to function as a virtual pubsub service, easing the discovery of syndicated data and event notifications associated with such a room.

last-revision.remark: Initial published version approved for publication by the XMPP Council.

xep.title: Nonzas (are not Stanzas)
xep.abstract: This specification defines the term "Nonza", describing every top level stream element that is not a Stanza.

last-revision.remark: Defer due to lack of activity.

xep.title: Jingle Encrypted Transports - OMEMO
xep.abstract: Extension for JET introducing OMEMO End-to-End Encrypted Jingle Transports.

last-revision.remark: Defer due to lack of activity.

xep.title: Abuse Reporting
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for reporting abusive traffic sent over an XMPP network. Note: This specification has been retracted in favor of XEP-0161, which now contains the content originally published in this specification.

xep.title: Compliance SIG
xep.abstract: A proposal to form a SIG devoted to issues related to protocol compliance.

xep.title: Message Delivery Receipts
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for message delivery receipts, whereby the sender of a message can request notification that the message has been delivered to a client controlled by the intended recipient.

xep.title: Stream Management
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for active management of an XML stream between two XMPP entities, including features for stanza acknowledgements and stream resumption.

xep.title: Impact of TLS and DNSSEC on Dialback
xep.abstract: This specification provides documentation how Server Dialback is used together with Transport Layer Security, and discusses how the security considerations of Dialback are changed by the introduction of TLS and/or DNSSEC.

xep.title: User Location
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for communicating information about the current geographical or physical location of an entity.

xep.title: Data Forms
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for data forms that can be used in workflows such as service configuration as well as for application-specific data description and reporting. The protocol includes lightweight semantics for forms processing (such as request, response, submit, and cancel), defines several common field types (boolean, list options with single or multiple choice, text with single line or multiple lines, single or multiple JabberIDs, hidden fields, etc.), provides extensibility for future data types, and can be embedded in a wide range of applications. The protocol is not intended to provide complete forms-processing functionality as is provided in the W3C XForms technology, but instead provides a basic subset of such functionality for use by XMPP entities.

last-revision.remark: Add incomplete submission form handling

xep.title: XMPP Extension Protocols
xep.abstract: This document defines the standards process followed by the XMPP Standards Foundation.

xep.title: SOCKS5 Bytestreams
xep.abstract: This document defines an XMPP protocol extension for establishing an out-of-band bytestream between any two XMPP users, mainly for the purpose of file transfer. The bytestream can be either direct (peer-to-peer) or mediated (though a special-purpose proxy server). The typical transport protocol used is TCP, although UDP can optionally be supported as well.

xep.title: Jingle ICE Transport Method
xep.abstract: This specification defines a Jingle transport method that results in sending media data using datagram associations via the User Datagram Protocol (UDP) or using end-to-end connections via the Transport Control Protocol (TCP). This transport method is negotiated via the Interactive Connectivity Establishment (ICE) methodology (which provides robust NAT traversal for media traffic) and also supports the ability to exchange candidates throughout the life of the session, consistent with so-called "Trickle ICE" (draft-ietf-ice-trickle).

xep.abstract: This specification defines a way to determine the time when a XMPP entity has last changed its presence. Using client initiated presence probes the current presence of subscribed XMPP users can be requested. In addition a protocol to request the uptime of servers and components is defined herein.

xep.title: Server to Server communication over STANAG 5066 ARQ
xep.abstract: This specification defines operation over XMPP over the NATO STANAG 5066 data link service for point to point links (ARQ). This enables optimized XMPP performance over HF Radio (which STANAG 5066 was designed for) and over other data links using STANAG 5066.

last-revision.remark: Make use of SLEP Streaming service, which was not available for 0.1. This provides a better service mapping than direct use of 5066 and provides compression.

xep.title: Data Forms Validation
xep.abstract: This specification defines a backwards-compatible extension to the XMPP Data Forms protocol that enables applications to specify additional validation guidelines related to a form, such as validation of standard XML datatypes, application-specific datatypes, value ranges, and regular expressions.

xep.title: Extensible In-Band Registration
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for in-band registration with instant messaging servers and other services with which an XMPP entity may initiate a stream. It aims to improve upon the state of the art and replace XEP-0077: In-Band Registration by allowing multi-factor registration mechanisms, and account recovery.

last-revision.remark: Error out if a client selects an invalid flow

xep.title: Direct MUC Invitations
xep.abstract: This specification defines a method for inviting a contact to a multi-user chat room directly, instead of sending the invitation through the chat room.

last-revision.remark: Added continue and thread attributes for feature parity with mediated invitations when converting a one-to-one chat to a groupchat.

xep.title: Server Dialback
xep.abstract: This specification defines the Server Dialback protocol, which is used between XMPP servers to provide identity verification. Server Dialback uses the Domain Name System (DNS) as the basis for verifying identity; the basic approach is that when a receiving server accepts a server-to-server connection from an initiating server, it does not process XMPP stanzas over the connection until it has verified the initiating server's identity. Additionally, the protocol is used to negotiate whether the receiving server is accepting stanzas for the target domain. Although Server Dialback does not provide strong authentication and is subject to DNS poisoning attacks, it has effectively prevented most address spoofing on the XMPP network since its development in the year 2000.

last-revision.remark: Update DNA framework reference to RFC 7712.

xep.title: Pubsub Attachments
xep.abstract: This specification provides a way to attach elements to a pubsub item.

last-revision.remark:
* Update reactions to be similar to
* Namespace bump

last-revision.remark: Corrected David Sutton's JID and email. It has been pointed out to me by amoungst others Rob Norris that things such as lists of JIDs and lists in general are really the province of disco and browse and that at least one of the suggested 'core' statistics doesn't make sense for all components so removed these from the document. This namespace was starting to become a generic data gathering namespace and we already have one of those, so I've reworked yet again hopefully for the final time it should now be simpler to implement and more consistent in all cases.

xep.title: Malicious Stanzas

This extension is also meant to provide a straightforward way of connecting SIP and XMPP clients to the same conference room.

The protocol is extensible via use of data forms, thus enabling services to gather a wide range of information during the registration process. The protocol also supports in-band password changes and cancellation of an existing registration.

xep.title: XMPP Transport Layer Security
xep.abstract: This document specifies the XMPP Transport Layer Security (XTLS) protocol. XTLS, which provides communications privacy for the Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol (XMPP), enables XMPP applications to communicate in a way that is designed to prevent eavesdropping, tampering, and forgery of XML stanzas. XTLS is based on Transport Layer Security (TLS) and integrated as security layer into Jingle. The protocol can be used for secure end-to-end messages as well as any other Jingle application like file file transfer.

last-revision.remark: Improved the documentation about exchanging passwords and certificates.

xep.title: Cryptographic Hash Function Recommendations for XMPP
xep.abstract: This document provides recommendations for the use of cryptographic hash functions in XMPP protocol extensions.

xep.title: Mediated Information eXchange (MIX)
xep.abstract: This document defines Mediated Information eXchange (MIX), an XMPP protocol extension for the exchange of information among multiple participants through a mediating service. The protocol can be used to model group communication applications such as chatrooms, although with greater flexibility and extensibility than existing groupchat technologies such as Multi-User Chat (MUC). Although MIX supports standard groupchat features such as discussion topics and invitations, and also defines a strong access control model similar to that of MUC, it enables users to participate without sharing presence, allows communication of any structured data (not only textual messages), reuses Publish-Subscribe so that users can receive only the information formats in which they are interested, and reuses Message Archive Management (MAM) to provide more robust storage and archiving.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Terms of Services
xep.abstract: This specification provides an in-band, unauthenticated way to request the Terms of Service of an XMPP service.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: XMPP Transport Layer Security
xep.abstract: This document specifies the XMPP Transport Layer Security (XTLS) protocol. XTLS, which provides communications privacy for the Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol (XMPP), enables XMPP applications to communicate in a way that is designed to prevent eavesdropping, tampering, and forgery of XMPP stanzas. XTLS is based on Transport Layer Security (TLS) and provides equivalent security guarantees. The protocol sends standard TLS handshake and application data encoded as Base64, similar to the XMPP In-Band Bytestreams (IBB) extension but qualified by a dedicated namespace.

last-revision.remark: * By popular demand, resurrected the proposal. * Removed IBB dependency and replaced it with a similar method in the XTLS namespace. * Added explicit proceed and closed elements in the IQ-result stanzas. * Removed seq attribute. * Moved offer semantics from XEP-0250 to this specification.

xep.title: Extended Channel Search
xep.abstract: This specification provides a standardised protocol to search for public group chats. In contrast to XEP-0030 (Service Discovery), it works across multiple domains and in contrast to XEP-0055 (Jabber Search) it more clearly handles extensibility.

However, the protocol could also be used over a direct TCP connection rather than over XMPP.

xep.title: Linked Process Protocol
xep.abstract: Linked Process is a protocol for distributed computing that facilitates the creation of an Internet-scale, general-purpose compute cloud. Any computing device with an Internet connection can consume and/or provide computing resources in a Linked Process cloud. Resource consumption occurs when a device migrates arbitrary code to another device for execution. Linked Process is applicable where it is necessary for a resource consumer to define the means by which a provider's resources are utilized.

xep.title: XMPP Resources Avatars
xep.abstract: This specification describes how to publish and retrieve avatars from XMPP resources.

last-revision.remark: Generalise to non-MUC resources.

xep.title: SIP/SDP Over XMPP (SoX)
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for communicating Session Description Protocol (SDP) data, along with relevant Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) headers. The SoX protocol is designed for use by XMPP-only endpoints that need to communicate raw SDP information (e.g., in WebRTC scenarios), not as a general-purpose replacement for the XMPP Jingle extensions.

last-revision.remark: Clarified scope and intent of the protocol.

xep.title: S2S Components
xep.abstract: This document describes a modernized method of connecting 'components' to a server, expressed as a profile of the existing standard server-to-server protocol.

last-revision.remark: * Initial Revision

xep.title: Spim Markers and Reports
xep.abstract: This document defines an XMPP protocol extension that enables XMPP entities to interact with spim filters by marking unsolicited or suspicious XMPP stanzas.

last-revision.remark: Initial version.

xep.title: Simple Buttons
xep.abstract: This specification provides a way to send simple buttons.

last-revision.remark: Polishing preparing for submission

xep.title: Message Carbons
xep.abstract: In order to keep all IM clients for a user engaged in a conversation, outbound messages are carbon-copied to all interested resources.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Buddycloud Channels
xep.abstract: This document describes a profile and conventions for usage of the PubSub protocol in the context of a new type of communication.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Recipient Server Side Notifications Filtering
xep.abstract: This specification defines a modern efficient way to deliver PubSub notifications.

last-revision.remark: Updated based on Council feedback.

xep.title: WebSocket S2S
xep.abstract: This specification defines a procedure to make s2s XMPP connections over WebSocket.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Extensible SASL Profile
xep.abstract: This document describes a replacement for the SASL profile documented in RFC 6120 which allows for greater extensibility.

last-revision.remark: * Initial Revision

xep.title: Customizable Message Routing
xep.abstract: This specification specifies customizable behavior of RFC 6121 section 8.5.2.1.1 to allow various message routing algorithms (e.g. for load balancing).

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Body Markup Hints
xep.abstract: This document specifies hints about the markup language used in elements.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Stanza Forwarding
xep.abstract: This specification defines best practices for delivery of XMPP stanzas that are forwarded from one address to another.

last-revision.remark: Changed service discovery feature to urn:xmpp:forwarding:0 in compliance with XMPP Registrar processes.

xep.title: MUC Affiliations Versioning
xep.abstract: This specification provides a way to reduce the amount of queries necessary to stay up-to-date with affiliations in a MUC room.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Message Fastening
xep.abstract: This specification defines a way for payloads on a message to be marked as being logically fastened to a previous message.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Two-factor user authentication with a shared secret
xep.abstract: This document specifies a two-factor authentication mechanism to check if a XMPP account exists and if it is trying to use or access services or resources of certain device, application or service. Authentication mechanism is based on transmitting a password using Ad-Hoc Commands. Password is calculated from shared secret.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Instant Gaming
xep.abstract: This document defines an XMPP protocol extension for serverless instant gaming in a one-to-one context.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Stanza Multiplexing
xep.abstract: This spec provides a mechanism for multiplexing multiple virtual hosts over a single XMPP session.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Room Activity Indicators
xep.abstract: This specification describes a lightweight mechanism for activity notifications in MUCs

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Digital Signatures in XMPP
xep.abstract: This document provides a technical specification for Digital Signatures in the Extensible Messaging and Presence Protocol (XMPP).

last-revision.remark: Proto-XEP draft.

xep.title: File Transfer Thumbnails
xep.abstract: This specification defines a way for a client supply a preview image for a file transfer.

last-revision.remark: Split use-case section into "Introduction", "Requirements", and "Use case".

xep.title: Pubsub Caching Hints
xep.abstract: This specification provides a way to get caching information from a Pubsub node

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: JSON Content Type support
xep.abstract: This specification defines JavaScript Object Notation (JSON) use in XMPP service.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Stateless file sharing
xep.abstract: This specification describes a protocol for stateless asynchronous file sharing with integrity and transport flexibility. It allows clients to provide a good interoperable user experience in combination with Carbons and MAM.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Anonymous unique occupant identifiers for MUCs
xep.abstract: This specification defines a method that allows clients to identify a MUC participant across reconnects and renames. It thus prevents impersonification of anonymous users.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Sensor-Over-XMPP
xep.abstract: This specification defines a payload format for communicating sensor and actuation information. The payload format is transported using the publish-subscribe mechanism described in XEP-0060.

last-revision.remark: Add data element to enclose transducerValue and transducerSetValue.

xep.title: Multi-User Chat Administration
xep.abstract: This specification defines how to administer Multi-User Chat rooms and services using Ad-Hoc Commands.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: JID Mention
xep.abstract: This specification provides a way for an entity to mention a jid

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Presence Decloaking
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension that enables a user to send directed presence with a request for the target to reciprocate.

last-revision.remark: Rewrote the introduction, clarified the security considerations, requested issuance of an appropriate URN from the XMPP Registrar.

xep.title: Incident Reporting
xep.abstract: This specification defines methods for incident reporting among XMPP server deployments.

last-revision.remark: Per Council feedback, moved server rosters to a separate specification.

xep.title: E2E Authentication in XMPP: CA Requirements
xep.abstract: This specification defines requirements for certificate authorities issuing X.509 certificates for e2e authentication in XMPP.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Message Replies
xep.abstract: This document defines a way to indicate that a message is a reply to a previous message.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: DNS Queries over XMPP (DoX)
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for sending DNS queries and getting DNS responses over XML streams. Each DNS query-response pair is mapped into an IQ exchange.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Order-By
xep.abstract: This specification allows to change order of items retrieval in a Pubsub or MAM query

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Problem Reporting
xep.abstract: This specification defines methods for reporting of network problems between XMPP server deployments.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Jingle SDP Content
xep.abstract: This specification defines a Jingle application type for transport the Session Description Protocol (SDP) over Jingle.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: REST with XMPP
xep.abstract: This specification defines how the Representational State Transfer (REST) architectural style can be applied to an XMPP overlay network. It specifies an XMPP protocol extension for accessing resources and transporting resource metadata and XML-REST encoded requests and responses between two XMPP entities.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: MUC Self-Ping (Schrödinger's Chat)
xep.abstract: This protocol extension for XEP-0045 Multi User Chat allows clients to check whether they are still joined to a chatroom.

last-revision.remark: Add handling for another corner case, change title to Council’s liking

xep.title: Server IP Check
xep.abstract: This specification defines a simple XMPP extension that enables a client to discover its external IP address.

last-revision.remark: Removed client inclusion of its IP address; added IPv6 example.

xep.title: Server-based Tic-tac-toe
xep.abstract: This document defines how to play a Tic-tac-toe game over XMPP

last-revision.remark: First Draft.

xep.title: Muji
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP protocol extension for initiating and managing multiparty voice and video conferences within an XMPP MUC

last-revision.remark: Second rough draft.

xep.title: Out-of-Band Stream Data
xep.abstract: This specification defines how to send parts of an XML stream over a direct connection between peers. This allows to send large stanzas or binary data without blocking the XML stream for other stanzas.

last-revision.remark: Simplify Example; Restrict Usage; Add abort

xep.title: Ephemeral Messages
xep.abstract: This specification encourages a shift in privacy settings wrt. logging policies.

last-revision.remark: Resubmit with some changes.

xep.title: File Sharing Notifications
xep.abstract: This specification provides a notification protocol for information about ongoing file uploads and media creation by the user.

last-revision.remark: Add upload-finished state, minor improvements.

xep.title: MUC presence versioning
xep.abstract: This specification defines a versioning mechanism which reduces the amount of presence traffic in a XEP-0045 MUC

last-revision.remark: First draft

xep.title: Tic-tac-toe
xep.abstract: This document defines how to play a Tic-tac-toe game over XMPP

last-revision.remark: First Draft.

xep.title: Moved 2.0
xep.abstract: This specification details a way for a user to notify their contacts about an account move.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: DMUC3: Distributed MUC
xep.abstract: This document provides a protocol for reducing the bandwidth cost of local users contributing to a remote MUC over a constrained link through a local mirror of the MUC room.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Simple JSON Messaging
xep.abstract: This specification proposes a simple mechanism by which applications can transfer data safely, without needing additional protocol design work. It is intended to provide a protocol that is trivial to implement and can be driven with a simple API.

last-revision.remark: Have another crack at getting this through Council. * Rename to a more obvious name * Remove IQ * Remove API, instead describe API requirements

xep.title: Federated MUC for constrained environments
xep.abstract: This document provides a protocol for reducing the bandwidth cost of local users contributing to a remote MUC over a constrained link through local proxying of the MUC room.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: OMEMO Media sharing
xep.abstract: An informal way of sharing media files despite limitations in the OMEMO encryption

last-revision.remark: * Resubmitted on the Historical track. * Added a section on IANA considerations.

xep.title: Distributed Multi-User Chat
xep.abstract: This document defines methods for distributing Multi-User Chat (MUC) rooms across multiple services.

last-revision.remark: Simplified the protocol to use a master-slave approach; modified terminology.

xep.title: The 'xmpp.pubsub' URI Scheme
xep.abstract: This document defines the format of Uniform Resource Identifiers (URIs) to identify nodes in the context of Publish-Subscribe services as well as items within the scope of such nodes.

last-revision.remark: Initial draft.

xep.title: Disco Feature Attachment
xep.abstract: This specification provides a way to indicate that a feature is implemented for a specific namespace

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Token-based reconnection
xep.abstract: This specification defines a token-based session authentication mechanism.

last-revision.remark: Removed mention of OAuth from Abstract; removed mention of DIGEST-MD5.

xep.title: Multi-Factor Authentication with TOTP
xep.abstract: This specification defines support for multi-factor authentication in terms of SASL2 Tasks based around the Time-based One Time Password mechanism.

last-revision.remark: So ABNF isn't well-formed XML, of course...

xep.title: Multi-User Gaming
xep.abstract: This document defines an XMPP protocol extension for multi-user gaming.

last-revision.remark: Added sections about entering non-anonymous, semi-anonymous and fully-anonymous rooms.

xep.title: User Rating
xep.abstract: This specification provides for the rating element.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Namespace Versioning in urn:xmpp
xep.abstract: This document describes the common practise of namespace versioning for the urn:xmpp URN namespace, and how this affects (and does not affect) the protocols which have such namespaces.

last-revision.remark: Noticed two conversations in two weeks. Must be time to reify this one. Added two new misconceptions; the author vs registrar one was mine.

xep.title: Stanza Content Encryption
xep.abstract: The Stanza Content Encryption (SCE) protocol is intended as a way to allow clients to securely exchange arbitrary extension elements using different end-to-end encryption schemes.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Content Rating Labels
xep.abstract: This specification provides a wire format in the form of a Service Discovery extension to allow services of various kinds to publish information about the kind of content they allow and/or endorse on their platform.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Client Key Support
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP binding of the supporting functions for the CLIENT-KEY SASL mechanism.

last-revision.remark: First draft

xep.title: Design Considerations for Digital Signatures in XMPP
xep.abstract: This document discusses considerations for the design of Digital Signatures in XMPP, including use cases and requirements. The document also discusses various ways XML Digital Signatures could be used in XMPP.

last-revision.remark: Proto-XEP draft.

xep.title: XMPP over QUIC
xep.abstract: This specification defines a procedure to make both c2s and s2s XMPP connections over the QUIC protocol instead of TCP+TLS.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Bidirectional Server-to-Server Connections
xep.abstract: This specification defines a protocol for using server-to-server connections in a bidirectional way such that stanzas are sent and received on the same TCP connection.

last-revision.remark: belated run-over pre-publication Added notes on authentication

xep.title: User Avatar to vCard-Based Avatars Conversion
xep.abstract: This specification describes a method for using PEP based avatars and vCard based avatars in parallel by having the user’s server do a conversion between the two.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Calendaring Extensions to Publish-Subscribe
xep.abstract: This specification defines calendaring extensions to Publish-Subscribe for the purposes of group calendaring and scheduling between "Calendar Users" (CUs), accessing, managing, and sharing calendaring and scheduling information on a Calendar Server, and a mechanism for alarm notifications.

last-revision.remark: Added XML schema; fixed a number of minor issues.

xep.title: Compatibility Fallbacks
xep.abstract: This document defines a way to indicate that a specific part of the body only serves as fallback and which specification the fallback is for.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: DOAP usage in XMPP
xep.abstract: This specification defines how XMPP projects can provide a machine-readable description of their abilities, and how external entities can interact with it.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Quality of Service
xep.abstract: This specification describes a generic method whereby messages can be sent between clients using a predefined Quality of Service level.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: XMPP Compliance Suites 2020
xep.abstract: This document defines XMPP protocol compliance levels.

last-revision.remark: First draft based on XEP-0412. Non-editorial Changes: * Added "Future Development" section

xep.title: Channel Binding Pseudomechanisms
xep.abstract: A method for advertising and negotiating types of channel binding supported by SCRAM based SASL mechanisms.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Pubsub Public Subscriptions
xep.abstract: This specification provides a way to make subscriptions to a node public

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: XMPP Compliance Suites 2022
xep.abstract: This document defines XMPP application categories for different use cases (Core, Web, IM, and Mobile), and specifies the required XEPs that client and server software needs to implement for compliance with the use cases.

last-revision.remark: First draft based on XEP-0443.

xep.title: MUC Mention Notifications
xep.abstract: This specification documents how a user may be informed when they're mentioned in a MUC which they're not currently joined to.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: E2E Authentication in XMPP: Certificate Issuance and Revocation
xep.abstract: This specification defines a way for a certificate authority to serve certificate signing requests via XMPP in order to issue X.509 certificates for the use in end-to-end and c2s SASL EXTERNAL authentication.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Authorization Tokens
xep.abstract: This document defines an XMPP protocol extension for issuing authentication tokens to client applications and provides methods for managing сlient connections.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: MAM Fastening Collation
xep.abstract: This specification proposes a mechanism by which MAM results containing fastenings can be collated effectively.

last-revision.remark: * Initial Revision

xep.title: Stickers
xep.abstract: This specification provides a protocol to send stickers and to create and share sticker packs.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Encryption for stateless file sharing
xep.abstract: This specification provides a protocol for sharing encrypted files using the stateless file sharing protocol (XEP-xxxx).

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Best practices for GDPR compliant deployment of XMPP
xep.abstract: This informational XEP provides information on deploying XMPP in way that is compliant with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) of the European Union.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: XMPP Over RELOAD (XOR)
xep.abstract: This specification defines an XMPP Usage of REsource LOcation And Discovery (RELOAD). The XMPP usage provides an ability for XMPP clients to discover other peers' location through the peer-to-peer overlay. Once a peer location is determined, the RELOAD AppAttach method is used to establish a direct connection between peers through which XMPP streams are exchanged.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Jingle In-Band Bytestreams Transport
xep.abstract: This specification defines a Jingle transport method that results in sending data via the In-Band Bytestreams (IBB) protocol defined in XEP-0047. Essentially this transport method reuses XEP-0047 semantics for sending the data and defines native Jingle methods for starting and ending an IBB session.

last-revision.remark: Rough draft.

xep.title: Server Rosters
xep.abstract: This specification defines a convention for trust between XMPP server deployments.

last-revision.remark: First draft, split from the incident reporting proposal.

xep.title: Shared BOSH
xep.abstract: This specification defines an extension to BOSH that allows multiple clients to share the same underlying XMPP connection.

last-revision.remark: First draft.

xep.title: Multi-User Chat Light
xep.abstract: This specification provides a presence-less standard for Multi-User Chats. Its feature set is a response to mobile XMPP applications needs and specific environment.

last-revision.remark: First full version.

xep.title: XMPP Connections across HTTPS (HACX)
xep.abstract: This specification defines a procedure to look up various connection methods for an XMPP server over HTTPS, with a focus on censorship resistance.

last-revision.remark: Fix requirements, editing, add alternatives.

xep.title: Domain Name Assertions
xep.abstract: An application-level approach to asserting and proving the delegated ownership of a domain name for server-to-server XMPP federation.

last-revision.remark: First draft.
